loans.name: Fuerza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fuerza está integrado por María Isabel A., Julieta Magdalena H. y Viki de los Ángeles  S. L.. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora A. de 44 años. Ella desde la edad de 19 años ha trabajado en la costura y actualmente su taller se ha especializado en trajes de danza para lo cual requiere del préstamo para comprar materiales como lentejuelas, cintas, telas, hilos, bordados, piedras….etc.

Mientras la señora H. de 47 de los cuales ha de dicado quince años a la costura y S. de 40 años tiene una pequeña venta.
texts.en:
María Isabel A., Julieta Magdalena H. and Viki de los Ángeles S. L. comprise the Fuerza Group. Mrs. A., 44, is the coordinator of the group. She has worked as a seamstress since she was 19. Her shop currently specializes in dance attire. She needs the loan to buy materials like sequins, ribbons, fabric, needles, embroidery, and jewels, etc. Señora H., 47, has worked as a seamstress for 15 years. Señora S., 40, has a small sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, needles, and ribbons, etc.

loans.name: Margort

texts.es:
La socia MARGORT pertenece al banco comunal “MINIBANK”, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 31 años de edad, es casada, ella esta embarazada va tener su primer hijo. Ella es profesora del nivel secundaria del colegio “San Juan Bautista de Coya”, Coya se encuentra en la ciudad de pisaq a 1 hora de la ciudad imperial del Cusco.

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su pequeño negocio de venta de material de arreglo de interiores como yeso, cemento, etc. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar la venta de materiales de decoración de interiores.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Margort is a member of the communal bank "Minibank," and is a native of the city of Cusco. Margort is 31 years-old, married, and is pregnant with her first child. She is a high school level teacher at "San Juan Bautista de Coya" school. Coya is located in Pisaq, about one hour away from the imperial city, Cusco. Besides taking care of the household, Margort has a small business selling material for interior repairs, such as plaster, cement, etc. This member needs this loan to increase her sales of interior decoration materials. Margort is grateful for the opportunity offered through the institution and at the same time promises to make the payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to increase sales of construction materials.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia C. is from the village of Cabanglasan, Bukidnon. Anastacia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Anastacia runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products such as soft drinks, beer, bread, and daily use products like soap in the local community. Anastacia has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anastacia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anastacia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Anastacia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Anastacia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to buy food and pay her weekly payments to HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Balyewunya Group 2, Mukono

texts.en: S. Stella is 44 years old and married with 4 children aged 18 – 8 years. She is a property manager selling plots of land, houses, and those for rent. At the same time, she is also a farmer with plantations as well as having cows and goats at her homestead. She has been in business for 10 years and she is able to pay school fees for her children plus taking care of their general welfare. She needs a loan to be able to buy a plot of land where she will keep her animals.

loans.use: Buying a plot of land for animal-raising

loans.name: Surenhorloo

texts.en: Surenhorloo is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife is a hairdresser for a private company. He lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and operates a taxi service in his town. He began his business in 2007 after working and living in Korea for two years. Since then, his working capital has grown and he plans to open a hair salon for his wife. Within a short period of operating his business, he has gained a good professional reputation among the people of his town as a safe, reliable driver. Surenhorloo would eventually like to buy a larger, more comfortable car so that he can transport more people across longer distances, which would increase his profits. He is requesting a 1,500,000-tugrug loan to purchase replacement parts for his taxi so that he can keep getting his customers where they need to go and furniture for his home.

loans.use: To purchase replacement parts for his taxi

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Como todo padre responsable, el señor Wilfredo L. trabaja en su propio negocio de venta de leña con el fin de brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos los que dependen de él. Ha iniciado la venta de leña en el municipio de Somotillo en Chinandega y son sus sueños mejorar este pequeño negocio para así estar satisfecho y que sus hijos tengan mejores condiciones de vida y se sientan satisfechos.
Para llevar a cabo esto, solicitó un crédito para la compra de la leña por lo que el crédito será utilizado a lo inmediato para dicha compra y así comercializarla y generar ingresos para su propio desarrollo en su localidad.
texts.en:
Like all responsible fathers, Wilfredo L. works to bring better living conditions to his dependent children. His business is selling firewood, a business which he set up in the Somotillo municipality in Chinandega. His dream is to improve his small business in order to be satisfied. He wants his children to have better living conditions and for them to feel satisfied. In order to do this, he asked for a loan to buy the firewood. The loan will be used immediately to make said purchase. That way he will sell it and generate income for his own growth in his location.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood

loans.name: Maryanne

texts.en: Maryanne is a 33 year old married woman with two sons and a daughter. She owns a boutique where she sells clothes. She employs one person. She has been running her business for three years and wants to purchase more stock with the KES 80,000 loan. Previously, she was employed in a tailoring shop. She hopes to expand her business and to own personal properties someday. Maryanne describes herself as hardworking and friendly.

loans.use: To increase inventory of clothes.

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela, de 37 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora. Vive en una casa de adobe (propia), junto a sus 3 hijos: Jerson de 18, Yosida de 12 y Lady de 6 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Los arduos días de trabajo que tiene en su chacra le han ayudado a mejorar la economía de su familia, ya que desde que su esposo falleció, hace 7 años, ella es el único sustento de su familia y tiene que velar por el bienestar de sus hijos, es por eso que trabaja en todo lo que puede, ya que también está en el negocio de la crianza de cuyes y cerdos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es cuidar sus papas y alverjas, pues sabe que esos productos se venden a mejor precio, lleva 17 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que subir los empinados cerros del poblado donde tiene sus chacras. Para el futuro, espera mejorar su producción y sembrar en totalidad todas sus tierras.

Este es el primer préstamo de Marianela con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no desea entrar en mora y perjudicar a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por la alegría que pone en las reuniones. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará pesticidas y herbicidas, para cuidar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Marianela is 37 years old and is a very happy and hard-working woman. She lives in an adobe house (her own), together with her 3 children: Jerson, 18, Yosida, 12, and Lady, 6, who are the motives for all her hard work. The arduous working days she has on her farm have helped her improve the economic situation of her family since her husband died 7 years ago. She is the only person who sustains her family and has to watch over the well-being of her children. It is for this reason that she works at everything she can, including her business of breeding guinea pigs and pigs. What Marianela likes most about her work is caring for her potatoes and peas, as she knows that the products can be sold at a good price. She has done this activity for 17 years and considers that the most difficult thing is having to climb the steep slopes of the town where she has her farm. In the future, she hopes to improve her production and sew crops throughout all of her land. This is Marianela's first loan with MFP and she is disposed to make all her repayments punctually as she doesn't want to be in debt and damage her communal bank, where she is much loved for the energy and happiness she brings to the meetings. With the 700 nuevos soles she is seeking she will buy pesticides and herbicides to look after her seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pesticides

loans.name: William Antonio

texts.es: Willian Antonio de 32 años de edad  habita junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa Tania Prado y su hijo William de 2 añitos, es Ingeniero Agronomo de profesion y brinda sus servicios profesionales en la Alcaldia de Nueva Guinea. Adicionalmente se dedica a la actividad ganadera desde hace seis años,  posee su pequeña parcela con un manejo técnificada de sistema silvo pastoril, pasto mejorado, con un inventario ganadero propio, de buena selección, tiene infraestructura para el ordeño de su ganado parido.  Esta solicitando su primer credito y espera ser beneficiado con el fondo kiva, para compra de ternero desarrollo, su mayor sueño es tener su propia empresa agropecuaria y trabajar de manera independiente, así poder crear mejores condiciones para el futuro de su familia, él tiene espiritu de superación, es un joven con mucho liderazgo en el Municipio.
texts.en:
William Antonio is 32 years old and lives with his family, which consists of his wife Tania Prado and their two year old son William. He is an agricultural engineer by profession and provides his professional services to the City of Nueva Guinea. In addition, he has been raising cattle for six years. William Antonio owns a small plot of land that contains a technical forestry management system, improved pastures, and his own herd of well-bred cattle. He also has the infrastructure for nursing the newborn calves.

William Antonio is requesting his first loan and hopes to be a beneficiary of Kiva funds so that he can buy a calf to raise. His greatest wish is to have his own agricultural business and work independently so that he can create better conditions for the future of his family. He has the spirit to succeed and has great leadership within the city.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Titus C.osondo

texts.fr: Monsieur Osondo tient un local a l’entrée  du marche de Ouakam ou il expose ses chaussures. Il évolue  dans le domaine de la cordonnerie  depuis 14 ans et il a beaucoup de passion et d’expérience  pour la confection de chaussures. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est l’aspect lucratif.  Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs. Une partie du financement sera  destine a  développer  une nouvelle activité  de restaurant par l’achat de matériels  à cuisiner et l’autre partie sera orientée  vers la confection  de chaussures. Le prêt lui permettra ainsi de diversifier son activité de commerce et en plus d’accroitre ses profits
texts.en:
Mr. Osondo has premises at the entrance to the market in Ouakam where he displays his shoes. He has been a developing a cobbler's business for the past 14 years and he has a lot of passion for and experience in making shoes. What interests him most is the profitability of this business. He is applying for a loan of 500,000 francs. Part of this loan will be used to buy equipment to develop a new activity in restauration, and the rest will be used for making shoes. The loan will thus allow him to diversify his business and also to increase his profits.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening of funds

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en:
Bolanle sew dresses and also sells women undergarments.  She goes to Lagos Island to buy clothing material as soon as her stock goes down. With this business she makes a living and takes care of other family needs. She has been in this business for over ten years. 

She is requesting a loan of 70,000 NGN to purchase more clothing materials at a reduced cost and also reduce the risk of been on the road more often. In the photo what she is holding is one of her pieces of finished work.

Bolanle is 45 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a plumber who sometimes helps her at the shop. She says thanks to Kiva- LAPO microfinance for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing materials to sew and sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 28-year-old single lady with a 2-year-old child. She has been selling clothes for five years in an open-air market to earn a living.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Mercy has been able to save her money with a group of friends who are also members of Faulu Kenya. She plans to add to her stock of children’s clothes and women’s clothes. For this reason, she has requested a loan of Kes 60,000 from Faulu Kenya.

Mercy hopes to expand her business into a wholesale operation in the future.

loans.use: To buy more children's and women's clothes to sell

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne E., 47, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Eduardo, a machine operator, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been into direct selling of food supplements while managing her own jewelry business for quite some time now.

Yvonne has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her jewelry business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more quantities and designs of jewelries needed to replenish her current product stock.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying more stocks (food supplements) and various designs of jewelries to replenish her current product stock

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.es: El grupo “Nuevo Renacer” esta representado por la señora Gaby y conformada por 13 miembros en su integridad mujeres, mismas que han demostrado ser muy responsables y trabajadoras. La señora Gaby es casada tiene 2 hijos, son niños en edad escolar, la señora se dedica a la venta de dulces y empanadas en una cancha deportiva concurrida del barrio, las expectativas de Gaby es tener un kiosco en el barrio para tener ventas más continuas y así obtener mas ingresos, ella vive en alquiler por el momento y los planes que tiene con su esposo  es mejorar su negocio y ahorrar para tener una casa propia, también desea poder darles una educación mas adecuada a sus hijos para que lleguen a obtener una profesión a futuro, ella requiere el préstamo para invertir en la construcción de un puesto fijo y para incrementar sus mercadería. El resto de las socias del grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades como la venta de ropa, venta de comida, zapatos, hamacas, empanadas y asaditos. El grupo en general tiene  experiencia en los negocios que desempeñan y es por esta razón que son conocidos en las ferias de su barrio donde venden sus productos. Si bien la competencia en general es bastante alta, el grupo cuenta con experiencia y también con clientes fijos que reconocen su trabajo y demandan sus servicios y productos, por otra parte es importante el entusiasmo que ponen a lo que hacen. El presente crédito será utilizado como capital de operaciones, con la compra de mercadería, insumos y herramientas de trabajo. La expectativa que tiene el grupo es de seguir trabajando para crecer u mejorar sus ingresos para darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. El banco tiene bastante experiencia crediticia ya que no es la primera vez que obtienen un crédito, el presente por ejemplo es su tercer ciclo en los cuales han demostrado responsabilidad, unidad y ganas de trabajar para salir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Nuevo Renacer" ("New Dawn") group is represented by Gaby and made up of 13 women who are responsible and hard-working. Gaby is married and has two children, who are of school age. She sells sweets and empanadas in a sports field popular in the neighborhood. Gaby would like to have a kiosk in the neighborhood so she can sell more regularly and thereby increase her income. At the moment, she is renter, and she and her husband plan to improve their business and save up for their own house. She also wants to give her children a better education so that they can have a profession in the future. She is asking for a loan to invest in the construction of a stand and to increase her merchandise. The other members of the group are involved in a variety of activities, including selling clothing, food, hammocks, savory pastries, and grilled food. The group as a whole is experienced in the activities in which it is involved, and for this reason, it is well-known at the neighborhood markets where it sells its products. Within this competitive environment, the group already has regular customers who are familiar with its work and ask for its services and products. The group is enthusiastic about what it does. This credit will be used as working capital for buying merchandise, raw materials, and work tools. The group expects to keep working in order to grow and to increase its profits so its members can give their families a better quality of life. Their bank is already familiar with this group--it is not their first loan, but their third funding cycle. They have previously demonstrated that they are responsible, united, and hard-working enough to look to the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Hourt

texts.en:
Mrs. Hourt S. is one of many Cambodian people who earn a living by planting crops. She is 41 years old and is the mother of five children, all of whom are single and work, and they live together in the farming home. Hourt S. has a life partner in her husband who works on the farm with her.

The coming rainfall season allows for farming but Hourt S. does not have money to buy any supplies to use on her field. Thus, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and crop seeds to plant.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and crop seeds to plant

loans.name: Sahiba

texts.en:
Sahiba A. is a 49-year-old entrepreneur who owns a beauty salon. She likes her job and started her business as soon as she had enough savings to open her own salon. Sahiba used to work in a general salon as a hair stylist but now she is independent and her monthly income is about 400 AZN. 

Sahiba's beauty salon is very popular because she is very quality specialist. She has about 15-20 clients a day, for hair cuts, hair coloring and styling. Brides are especially good for income as their styling is quite expensive. 

Sahiba is married and has three children. She has applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase new tools and make renovations in her beauty salon.

loans.use: purchase new tools and renovations at her salon

loans.name: René

texts.fr: N. René est né le 10 Mars 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. René est marié à HOUNSINOU Clotilde, une coiffeuse. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés.  René s’est installé depuis huit ans evirons, au quartier Dandji, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où il habite avec sa femme et ses enfants. René subvient principalement aux besoins de sa famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. René a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire et appris ensuite la coiffure. René exerce cette activité depuis trois ans. Dans le but d’équiper son salon de coiffure de matériels nécessaire au bon fonctionnement de son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, René sollicite pour une première fois, de crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
René N. was born on March 10, 1980, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. He's married to Clotilde HOUNSINOU, a hairdresser. The couple has two children, who both attend school. Approximately eight years ago, René moved in to the Dandji neighborhood in Sèmè-Podji, where he lives with his wife and children. René is the family's main bread earner, thanks to the income drawn from his business. He dropped out of middle school, and was then trained as a hairdresser. He's been running this business for three years. With the goal of outfitting his salon with the equipment he needs to do his job properly, as well as to better meet customer demand, René is for the first time seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clippers and haircare products

loans.name: Nancy Karina

texts.es: Nancy, tiene 31 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos y una casa propia. Ella y su esposo se han dedicado a la venta y servicio de materiales electricos, el negocio esta situado en otro municipio retirado de su vivienda, tienen una amplia experiencia en el negocio ya que tienen 10 años de laborar en ella. Nancy atiende el negocio con su calido trato y logra el retorno de sus clientes. Por ello esta en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito ya que su negocio tiene mucha demanda y necesita comprar material para darles un mejor servicio y poder tneer mas ganacias. El sueño de Nancyes darle una mejor vivida y educación a sus hijos, y sabe que lo puede conseguir luchando cada día y trabajando.
texts.en:
Nancy is 31 years old, has two children, and lives in her own home. She and her husband sell and service electrical equipment. Their business is located in another town away from their home. Nancy and her husband have ten years of experience running their business. She is in charge of the day-to-day management and warmly welcoming her customers, which encourages them to return.

Nancy is requesting a loan because her business is in great demand. She needs to buy materials so that she can provide the best service and generate the most revenue. Her dream is to provide her children with an education and a better life. She knows that she has to continue struggling and working each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of electrical supplies

loans.name: Martha Fabiola

texts.es:
Martha de 28 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (en una zona urbana, con una ecología en construcción). Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de dulces en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Su esposo vende pollos y tienen dos hijos, pero debido a los pocos ingresos que tenían, ella decidió invertir sus ahorros y comprar dulces para vender a sus conocidos, poco a poco con esfuerzo, a podido tener una pequeña dulcería en la parte delantera de su casa, trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 20h00pm. 

Para surtir mas su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo dulces y galletas, en el futuro quiere obtén mas cliente y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Martha is 28 years old and lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (in an urban zone under construction). She has a small candy store in the front part of her home. She and her husband have two children. Her husband also sells chickens, but because of the low income they had, she decided to invest her savings to buy candy to sell to her acquaintances. Little by little, with some effort, she has been able to establish a small candy store in the front part of her home. She works from 7:30 AM to 8:00 PM. She wants to use the money from this loan to buy candy and cookies so that she can offer a greater variety in her business. In the future she wants to have more customers and wants her children to complete their education with enthusiasm.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cookies and candy

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Madame Khady S.  est une femme mariée de 55 ans qui habite  à Cambérene. Elle gère un magasin ou elle exerce la vente d’habits depuis plus de 3 ans déjà. Auparavant c’est son mari qui lui envoyait des habits qu’elle vendait sur le marché. Et c’est par la suite qu’elle a acquit ce magasin. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Cambérene  depuis mai 2005.Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs dans le but de renforcer son stock pour répondre a la demande de la clientèle en cette période  de préparation des fêtes. Ce financement lui permettra de développer  son activité, de maximiser ses bénéfices et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khady S. is a 55 year-old married woman who lives in Cambérene. She manages a shop where she has been selling clothing for more than 3 years. Previously, her husband sent her the clothing that she sold in the market. Subsequently, she got this store. She has been a member of the Cambérene credit union since May 2005. She is requesting a loan of 250,000 frs with the goal of increasing her stock to respond to customer demand during preparations for the holidays. This financing will enable her to expand her business, maximize her profit and better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Mrs. Yin T. is a single mother of two children. One of her children is already married and lives independently, while the remaining one stays at home and works sewing clothes in industry. 

Yin T. has been cultivating crops to earn a living. As the farming season approaches, Yin T. lacks money to plant a rice crop and is asking for a loan in order to buy fertilizer and seeds for growing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for growing

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.es:
Gertrudes es casada y tiene 5 hijos que estudian, Gertrudes viaja a la comunidad de Alpachaca de donde compra quesos y luego lo vende en el mercado de Ayacucho. Además Gertrudes tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su pueblo de Satica, también vende verduras, frutas y quesos. Gertrudes tiene ganado y también elabora quesos.
Gertrudes es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy y solicita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Gertrudes son construir su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gertrudes is married and has five children who are in school. She travels to the community of Alpachaca where she buys cheeses to sell later at the market in Ayacucho. In addition, Gertrudes has a grocery store in the town of Satica where she sell vegetables, fruits and cheeses. She has cows and makes her own cheeses.

Gertrudes is a member of the Tarpuy Communal Bank and requests a loan of 1600 PEN to invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Her dreams are to build a house in the city of Ayacucho and see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar

loans.name: Cecibel Alexandra

texts.es:
Cecibel Alexandra Ragundi M. tiene 31 años. Es casada vive con el esposo y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.  

Cecibel es una socia de la ventanilla rural La Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en mayoría este grupo se reúne cada mes en el sector del barrio San Vicente.

Cecibel trabaja en el comercio vende ropa y perfumes,  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y puerta a puerta.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es tener dinero para comprar carro y casa y dar el estudio a los hijos.
Le gusta caminar con la familia.
texts.en:
Cecibel Alexandra Ragundi M. is 31 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and three children in the canton of Ventanas, located in the Los Ríos province.

Cecibel is a member of the La Esperanza communal bank, which is located 25 kilometers from the canton of Ventanas. It is a community dedicated primarily to commerce. The group meets every month in the San Vicente neighborhood.

Cecibel works selling clothing and perfumes. She makes her purchases in Guayaquil and sells them from a business in her house, and door-to-door.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of merchandise to expand her business. The support of the loan would help her financially to meet her needs. Her dream is to have money to buy a car and house, and to educate her children. She likes to walk with her family.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to expand her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio San Arroyo Porá  surguió por promociones realizadas en la zona, el grupo se encuentra en el 9º ciclo, es un comité antiguo opera con la Fundación desde el año 2006  con pagos excelentes, tienen un ahorro de 3.487.320  Gs. . 
La Directora General es la Sra. María del Pilar T. es casada con 1 hijo, su marido  es albañil, ella invierte en compra de ropas de un comercial donde consigue a buenos precios por la compra en cantidad, luego lleva a su zona y realiza la venta en forma ambulante y también sobre pedido.
 Comenta la Sra, María del Pilar que el crédito que recibe dentro del comité es de mucho valor para ella ya que cada vez que recibe   vuelve a invertir en su negocio y de sus ganancias paga la cuota de su comité y también es un ingreso importante para su familia.
 En esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para la compra de remeras, camisas, blusa de varios colores y modelos para la temporada, shorts, jeans y otros.
texts.en:
This group from San Arroyo Porá neighborhood came together as a result of promotional activities in their area.  The group is in its 9th loan cycle.  It is a long-standing communal bank which has been with Fundación Paraguaya since 2006.  They have made excellent repayments and have savings of 3,487,320 Paraguayan guaranis.

The director of the bank is Mrs María del Pilar T..  She is married with one child.  Her husband is a bricklayer.  She buys clothes from a sales rep.  She obtains them at a good price because she buys in bulk.  She then transports the clothes to the area where she lives and sells them in an itinerant manner and also on request.

Mrs María del Pilar comments that the loan which she receives within her communal bank is very valuable to her since each time she receives it she re-invests it in her business.  From her profits, she makes her repayment to her communal bank and also has a considerable income for her family.

On this occasion she is requesting the loan to buy t-shirts, shirts, blouses of different colors and styles for the season, shorts, jeans etc.

loans.use: Purchase of t-shirts, dresses, blouses, shorts, jeans

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Duo Silidario Kayros De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
DUO  SOLIDARIO KAYROS DE SAN BARTOLO
La señora Nohelia Haydee, 20 años  quien se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles , nos comenta que su negocio existe gracias a la liquidación  salarial que ella  y su esposo recibieron  en una empresa donde trabajaban  cuando tenía 15 años, y por políticas uno de los dos tenía que retirarse, los dos decidieron retirarse, y  es así como ellos emprendieron con este negocio,  y tienen el anhelo de seguir invirtiendo pues le ha ido bien, pero requieren de mas capital, por eso solicita este crédito para la compra de productos comestibles   su hermana  la señora Shirley  quien se dedica a la venta de refacciones, dice que inicio con la venta de frijol preparado, volteados,  por lo que ella necesita de capital, por eso solicita este crédito para comprar productos comestibles por mayor para elaborar comida , teniendo así un mejor ingreso con la que colabora al sustento de su hogar.
texts.en:
DUO  SOLIDARIO KAYROS DE SAN BARTOLO 
20-year old Señora Nohelia Haydee sells groceries. She bought the business with the settlement she and her husband received from the company where she had worked since she was 15 years old. For political reasons one of them had to leave, so they both decided to leave, and that’s when they started the business. Their greatest wish is to continue building the business as it has done well, but they need more capital. For this reason Nohelia is seeking a loan to buy more stock. 

Her sister Señora Shirley sells snacks. She explains that she is starting out by selling refried bean dishes, but she needs a loan to buy the ingredients at wholesale prices. This way she will have more income and be able to contribute to household expenses.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
This is 58 year old Abu T.. He is married and has three children ages 4, 12 and 20. In 1980, Abu established his used clothing business. He began his business because he wanted to generate income and continue to improve the living conditions of his family. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 300000 SLL every month. 

He would like a loan in the amount of  3000000 SLL in order to buy more stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 250000 SLL. 

In the future, Abu plans to expand his business. He would also like build a house for his family and continue to educate his children to university level. Abu finds it challenging to meet the high cost of living and transportation in Makeni, and he thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy used clothing for resale

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
El Señor Fredy Fernández Brañez vive en concubinato y es padre de familia de un hijo al cual apoya y ayuda en su educación junto a su pareja, hace como un año que vive con su pareja ellos viven en su chaco cuentan con una casita de madera que les sirve de refugio y de techo para dormir, es por eso que él trabaja como agricultor y como moto taxista  en la localidad de Ivirgarzama, en el cual esta hace mas de 1 año como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y mejorar el servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos y consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fredy Fernández Brañez lives with his partner and is father to one son who he supports and helps in his education, along with his partner. He has lived with his girlfried for one year. They live in a small wooden house that serves as a refuge and a place to sleep. It is for this that he works as a farmer and as a mototaxi driver in the area of Ivirgarzama, where for more than one year he has been an active member. The service he provides is profitable due to the high quantity of people that request this service due to its ease, speed and efficiency. The union has stops and turns for each affiliate in different points of the area if Ivirgarzama where people go to request this service.

This is the first time that the client has obtained a loan from our institution. It will be used to purchase a new motorcycle since the one he has currently has already completed its working cycle and so he can improve the service for his customers which will also improve his income and consequently his quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase a new motorcycle for his job.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC WATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan; el tiene 58 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa para bebes, el socio también trabaja en el instituto nacional de cultura, el socio trabaja junto con su esposa vendiendo la ropa para bebes, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa para bebe. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa para bebes al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juan, 58, is a member of the “SUMAC WATA” communal bank located in Cusco district which is part of Cusco province and department.

He is married and has three children.  He alternates daily chores with the sale of baby clothes.  He also works at the National Institute of Culture.  He works together with his wife selling clothing for babies.  He wants to expand the baby clothes business.  He is asking for a loan to buy baby clothes at wholesale.

He is happy with the loan and promises to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy baby clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora María B. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por la comunidad de Patamarca en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza natural y cultural, su variedad en la gastronomía cautiva los paladares de propios y extraños.

La Señora. María tiene 41 años, es casada, y tiene 4 hijos de 23, 22, 18 y 16 años de edad, su primera hija trabaja solo para sus gastos, su segundo hijo es casado y vive  independiente, su tercer hijo estudia en la universidad y su ultima hija esta estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María se dedica a la agricultura, siembra verduras y hortalizas a las que vende en su propia comunidad, también cría  animales como: cerdos, cuyes y gallinas.
 
Se encuentra con su primer cerdito y fue invitada al banco comunal por su hermana, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos. Su meta es tener un criadero de pollos más grande.
texts.en:
María B. is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Floreciendo [Women Blooming]. She lives in the community of Patamarca in the city of Cuenca. This city is reknowned for its natural and cultural beauty. Its gastronomical variety captivates the palates of both locals and strangers.

María is 41 years old, married, and has four children aged 23, 22, 18, and 16. Her eldest daughter works independently to cover her expenses, her eldest son is married and lives independently, her younger son studies at university, and her youngest daughter is studying in a high school in the city. Her husband works in construction as a mason, and together they built their own home.

María works in agriculture, planting vegetables which she sells in her own community. She also raises animals like pigs, guinea pigs and hens.

This is her first loan. She was invited to the communal bank by her sister. She is going to invest in the purchase of chickens. Her goal is to have a larger chicken hatchery.

loans.use: Purchase chickens

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza U. is from the village of Manuyog, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old and married with five school-aged children. Liza owns and operates a service-based business that provides motorcycle and vans repair services to local community members. This picture shows her husband, who is the main serviceman, and her son who helps them in their business. Liza has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. 

Liza joined HSPFI in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided by her business. Liza is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase needed tools. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Liza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria A. lives in the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 55 years old, married and has three grown children. For the last 25 years, she has made a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) retail shop where she sells products people need daily such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snacks and beverages. She earns about PHP 4,000 a month from her work.

In 2002, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business  She has successfully repaid six previous loans from HSPFI and is applying for a new one, for 12,000 PHP, to buy additional products to sell such as biscuits and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to continue expanding her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa A. is divorced and has five children. For the past 10 years, she has made a living by selling items such as soap, steel wool and starch in Kokowada, Elmina. 

As a sole breadwinner, her priority is to bolster her earnings. She plans to do this by growing her business. The loan will allow her to purchase more items for sale. The extra profits will be reinvested back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: The loan will allow her to purchase more items for sale

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal, who creates artistic handmade items, is from Marka- Amman. She is a 43-year-old widow and the mother of five.

Through Souk Ayyadi (an initiative of Tamweelcom which was ushered into existence to expand clients' promotional base)  Dalal found that she could increase her sales and expand her client base. This developed her business and helped her to assess the market needs.

Dalal is requesting a loan of 1,200 JOD to expand her artistic projects and improve her profitability. An aspiration of Dalal is to open her own shop where she can sell her products independently, which will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to expand her artistic projects and improve her profitability

loans.name: Jhony

texts.es: Jhony tiene 21 años, vive con su esposa, ella se encuentra en estado de gestación y juntos viven en una casa que le fue heredada por parte de sus padres. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de animales como vacas, ovejas y caballos, actividad que lo realiza durante hace 3 años. Para ella este trabajo es muy importante por que gracias a ello pudo generarse los ingresos suficientes para cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Es así que comprar los animales tiernos y a un bajo costo, para luego engordarlos y cuando lleguen a un tiempo desarrollado los vende en la feria ganadera a un mayor precio, así recupera lo invertido adicional a sus ganancias. Por otro lado posee terrenos que son para cultivo, ubicado en la selva central, ahí siembra café, que es un producto muy rentable y de mucha demanda en el mercado. Sus planes es el de seguir creciendo en capital y extender la siembra de café. Es su primer crédito que solicita de manera grupal con MFP, se siente agradecido porque considera que este préstamo es un apoyo para mejorar su negocio y por ello se compromete ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para contratar peones para que cosechen café, y cuyas ganancias  serán destinadas a la compra de más animales.
texts.en:
Jhony is 21 years old and lives with his wife. She is pregnant and together they live in a house that was inherited from their parents. Jhony sells animals such as cows, sheep, and horses, as he has done for  the last 3 years. For his wife, this work is very important because thanks to it, he can generate sufficient income to cover the family's necessities.

That's why he needs to buy young animals at a low cost, then to fatten them and when they arrive at a state of development, to sell them in the livestock fair at a higher price, thus recovering the additional investment and earning a profit.

In addition, Jhony has land under cultivation, located in the central rain forest. Here he sows coffee, a product that is very profitable and in high demand in the market. His plan is to continue growing his capital and extending the coffee plantings.

This is Jhony''s first loan as a group member with MFP. He is very grateful because he considers the loan helpful in improving his business, and he promises to be punctual in his payments. The loan will be invested in hiring laborers to harvest coffee. The resulting earnings will be destined for buying more animals.

loans.use: TO HIRE DAY LABORERS TO HARVEST HIS COFFEE CROP

loans.name: Leonilito

texts.en:
Leonilito G. is from the village of Aurora Zamboaga Del Sur. He is 36 years old. Leonilito is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Leonilito owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. Leonilito has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Leonilito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Leonilito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Leonilito is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This will be the second loan taken out by Leonilito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Aijan's Group

texts.en:
Aijan T. is the leader of this group. She is 42 and married to a driver. Her husband earns money by transporting passengers from Balykchi to Bishkek. Together they are bringing up three daughters and a son. The oldest daughter and the son study at university and the other children are at school.

Aijan herself works as a librarian at school. Eight years ago she was selling grocery products at the market, and then she saved some money and purchased a mini-bus “Mercedes Sprinter” for her husband. Since that moment her husband has been working as a driver. Aijan applied for the loan because they need money to purchase tires for the truck. In the future she wants to improve their living conditions and provide all her children a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase tires for the truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for 26 bags of different types of groundnuts.

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en: Dominador is 47 years old and married with three school-aged children. He grows corn and has been doing it for 10 years. He earns about Php 30,000 per crop as a farmer working in the Philippines. Dominador is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds to grow. In the future, Dominador hopes that his farming business will improve and support the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds to grow

loans.name: Quarashi

texts.en: Quarashi is an individual client from Ibanda. He is 26 years old and single with no child yet. He is a businessman with a garage and spare parts business in Katojo trading center, where he has operated for three years. At the moment, he has not employed anyone else since the business is still growing. However, he is able to generate about $106 as income monthly, and he hopes that this will increase soon. He is also involved in the sale of bananas from his plantation as his mother business, and his hard work has enabled him to succeed. His dream is to be able to increase production from his plantains as he continues to see his garage attract more customers. He needs to buy more spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Anabell Jessenia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Masaya, reside doña  Anabell Jessenia. Casada con dos hijos menores, trabaja  arduamente para darle las condiciones necesarias.
 La señora trabaja en el mercado municipal de Masaya, vendiendo todo estilo de calzado para niños, niñas, adolecentes y  adultos desde hace seis años, ella se ha preocupado por mantener su negocio con variedad de calzado y así siempre mantener la venta diaria ya que del negocio ha podido darles los estudios y alimentación a sus hijos. Unas de las necesidades que está atravesando doña  Anabell es la compra de calzado colegial, es por eso que  se acerco a las oficina de Ceprodel  para renovar su crédito y así poder comprarle a sus proveedores los calzados que tienen más demandas en este tiempo, y obtener más ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Anabell Jessenia lives in the city of Masaya.  She is married and has two minor children.  She works arduously to give them the necessities.

She works at the Masaya municipal market.  She has been selling all styles of footwear for boys, girls, adolescents, and adults for six years.  She has been concerned about keeping a variety of footwear in her business.  That way she can maintain her daily sales.  Through her business she has been able to feed her children and give them an education.

One of the needs that Anabell is experiencing is the purchase of school shoes.  That is why she came to the Ceprodel office to renew her loan.  That way she will be able to buy from her suppliers the shoes that are in the most demand during this time.  She will get more income to supply her children with the necessities.

loans.use: to buy school shoes for men, women, and children.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena de 36 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser  agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace algún tiempo Filomena se dedica a la comercialización de aves de corral (pavos,gallina y patos), los cría en los corrales que tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades familiares.  También cuenta con una mototaxi que es de su propiedad, la cual la maneja su esposo para tener otro ingreso.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 600 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados, una vez que engorden poder ofertarlos a sus clientes y con las ganancias pagar el crédito otorgado y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.  Filomena con trabajo y empeño a logrado salir adelante poco a poco y su deseo es brindarle a sus hijos otras oportunidades académicas en un futuro.
texts.en:
Filomena, 36, lives with her husband and children in her own home.  Her house does not have basic utilities; it is located in a rural area of the Tambogrande district in the department of Piura.  This area is known for its agriculture, livestock and handicrafts.

For some time now, Filomena has been selling poultry (turkeys, hens and ducks.)  She raises them in corrals that she has in the back of her house.  She feeds them with nutritionally balanced feed and natural grains.  Once they are fully grown, she sells them to her customers or in different markets in the area, and with the income she is able to pay for her family's basic needs.  She also has a mototaxi that she owns; her husband drives it to generate another income.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 600 Peruvian soles to buy poultry feed.  Once she fattens her poultry, she will be able to offer them for sale to her customers, and with the earnings she will be able to pay off the loan and improve her family's standard of living.  Filomena has managed to get ahead gradually with hard work and effort.  Her desire is to provide her children with other academic opportunities in the future.

loans.use: buy nutritionally balanced feed and natural grains for her poultry business

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: Aileen, who is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, works hard to support her family.  In business for 10 years now, she is requesting a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment for her enterprise. In the future, Aileen would like to save money to expand her operation.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment for her business.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El señor Félix vive en la zona de bajo Huayrapata su familia integra de su esposa Leticia y sus dos hijas que se encuentran en edad escolar, el trabaja con su vehículo trasportando materiales de construcción, y su esposa trabaja en una tienda que se encarga de vender medias deportivas como encargada de ventas, ambos aportan a la familia, el sr.  Félix como padre responsable se encarga también en llevar y recoger a sus hijas ya el trabajo de la esposa le impide hacerlo. Él necesita el préstamo de dinero para la reparación de su vehículo ya que para esta reparación tiene que comprar una nueva caja, motivo por el cual se pide el financiamiento con la institución.
texts.en:
Félix lives in the Bajo Huayrapata zone.  His family consists of his wife, Leticia, and their two daughters who are school age.  He works with his vehicle transporting building materials.  His wife is employed as a salesperson in a store selling athletic socks.  They both share the family’s support. Félix, as a responsible father, is also in charge of taking his daughters to school and picking them up since his wife can’t do it because of work.  

He needs this loan to repair his vehicle because he needs to buy a new transmission for this repair and this is why he’s asking the institution for a loan.

loans.use: to buy a transmission and for general maintenance.

loans.name: Sonia Margot

texts.es:
Sonia nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 28 años de edad. Ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y donde realiza sus actividades. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas, gaseosas en su propio kiosco. Ya son seis años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. El crédito que requiere Sonia es para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo galletas, gaseosa, pasteles, chicles, caramelos y otras cosas más. 

El Banco Comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Urubamba (Cusco, Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Sonia, 28, was born in the Peruvian city of Cusco.  She and her partner have two children.  She now lives in the city of Urubamba where she operates her kiosk business.  She sells snacks, soft drinks, etc.  She has operated the business for six years and says that she is happy with her progress.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise for resale: crackers, soft drinks, pastries, gum, candy and other general merchandise.

The Senor de los Milagros de Urubamba community bank meets every thirty days in the city of Urubamba (Peru).  The region is famous for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and for Machu Piccu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: Manuela, de 44 años es una valerosa madre soltera de 4 hijos a los que cuida con mucho amor y cariño en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Kivinaki (selva central peruana). El rostro serio de está trabajadora mujer, denota su constante lucha por sacar adelante a sus hijos. Desde las primeras horas del día como hace 11 años, se dirige a cuidar sus cultivos de café y naranja, los cuales le proporcionan buenas ganancias en las negociaciones que realiza a los intermediarios que visitan sus 3 terrenos cultibables en cada cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pasar la mayor parte en el campo; “construí mi casa dentro de mis plantaciones”, afirma contenta. Paralelo a esta actividad, ella realiza jornadas de trabajo, en cultivos de sus vecinos; quienes le pagan un dinero extra por su trabajo. Ahora está planeando sembrar en mayores cantidades, pues requiere de mayor capital, además se está preparando para la cosecha de naranja en el mes de octubre. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está segura podrá alcanzar sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Después de la cosecha de café, Manuela piensa limpiar sus terrenos agrícolas. Por ello de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas para comenzar su trabajo. Asimismo varias calaminas para arreglar su pequeña casa.
texts.en: Manuela, 44, is a courageous single mother of 4 children who cares for them with a lot of love and affection in her own home, located in her native community of Kivinaki (in the central Peruvian rainforest.)  In the serious expression on the face of this hardworking woman, you can see her constant struggle to get ahead and support her children.  From the early hours of the morning, as she has done for 11 years, she goes to care for her coffee and orange crops, which provide her with good earnings through her negotiations with the intermediaries that visit her 3 plots of land every harvest season.  What she likes most about her work is spending most of her time in the country.  "I built my house in the middle of my fields," she says, contentedly.  In addition to growing her own crops, she also makes some extra money by working on her neighbor's farms.  Now she is planning to cultivate larger quantities, for which she needs more capital, and she also is preparing to harvest her oranges in the month of October.  She belongs to the communal bank "Flor de Almendra," and this is their second loan cycle with MFP.  With this loan, she is sure that she can reach her goals.  In addition, she pledges to be punctual with her payments.  After the coffee harvest, Manuela plans to clear the fields she uses for farming.  To do this, once the loan is disbursed, she will use the money to buy tools to start this work and she will also buy some sheets of corrugated metal roofing material to make some repairs to her small house.

loans.use: to buy agricultural tools and also to buy corrugated metal roofing material for the roof of her house

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 46 años, es una mujer alegre y emprendedora, esta casada y es madre D. cuatro hijos D. los cuales dos ya son mayores e independientes y solo los dos últimos viven con ella y su esposo, en su casa propia. El trabajo D. Martha consiste en la venta D. abarrotes, así como la D. carne D. pollo, en ese mismo lugar ofrece también a su clientela cosméticos que previamente son elegidos por medio D. catálogos. Tiene 12  años trabajando este lugar y gracias a éste trabajo es que pudo dar a sus hijos una buena educación. Manifiesta que le gusta lo que hace porque dispone D. tiempo para dedicarse a otras cosas, entre ellas la D. cuidar a sus hijos. Martha piensa seguir trabajando para consolidar su negocio, y con las ganancias remodelar y acondicionar su casa con varias habitaciones para alquilarlos, pues el negocio D. inmuebles le resultaría mucho más rentable. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, en la que asegura cumplirá con el pago D. sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, comprará algunos productos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Martha, age 46, is a happy and enterprising woman who is married and the mother of four children. Two of her children are independent adults and only her two youngest live with her and her husband in their home. 

Martha sells groceries, such as chicken meat, and also offers her customers mail-order cosmetics at the same location. She has spent 12 years working out in this location, thanks to which she has been able to proviD. her children with a good education. She says she likes what she does because it allows her time for other things as well, such as raising her children. 

Martha plans to continue building her business and, with the profits, to remodel and air-condition her house with several rooms which she plans to rent as doing so would be much more profitable. This will be her first loan with MFP [Kiva field partner], to which she has assured that she will make her payments. With the amount she is taking out, she will buy products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia es una joven mujer negociante que se dedica al comercio y a la venta de alimentos, actividades  que surgieron para apoyar a su numerosa familia fortaleciendo su ingreso. En su casa hay varios negocios, su padre tiene una tienda arrendada, mientras  su madre y ella se dedican a la preparación y venta de alimentos alimentos, trabajan diariamente y desde la 6 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. A su edad de 21 años, tiene como meta principal terminar sus estudios universitarios y por eso todos los días se esmera en el crecimiento de su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el  comprará materias primas e insuos para las comidas   y  hará adecuaciones a su cocina y a la sala, pues  desea organizar la venta de sus alimentos en la sala de su casa,  ya que funciona en la terraza donde la lluvia muchas veces baja la venta y esto es uno de los más grandes desafíos que enfrenta.
texts.en:
Claudia is a young businesswoman who works in the retail trade and sells food. Through these businesses, she has been able to push forward in order to help her large family with their income. There are several businesses that operate in her home. Her father has a rented store while she and her mother prepare and sell food. They work every day from 6am to 3pm.

At 21 years of age, Claudia’s main goal is to finish her university studies which is why she strives to grow her business every day. She is currently applying for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Doming and will use the money to buy ingredients and supplies for her dishes. Claudia will also make renovations to her kitchen and living room because she wants to have an organized space in her house for selling food. Her business is currently located on the terrace where it rains. Many times this has resulted in low sales, which is one of the greatest challenges that she must face.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her dishes and to make renovations to her kitchen and living area.

loans.name: Mala

texts.en:
Mala (in the photo) is 36 years old and her husband, Ratha, is 42 years old. They have been married since 1993 and have four children, three sons and one daughter, who are in school. The daughter just finished her baccalaureate degree and she is now in her first year of university. The family is living in a village on National Road Number 2, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mala is a hair dresser; she runs her own hairdressing shop at home. Her husband has full-time employment.  Mala is asking for her first Kiva loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle for her daughter to drive to her university classes.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her daughter to drive to school.

loans.name: Park

texts.en: Park, 44 years old, sells peanuts and sugar palm and earns $3 per day. Her husband provides motorbike with a cart attached services and earns $3 per day. They have four children. One is two years old, one is studying and two are working. Each earns $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $12 on school fee, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy a motorbike to transport peanuts and sugar palm to sell. She wants to buy grocery goods to sell in front of her house so that she can make better income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport peanuts and sugar palm to sell

loans.name: Amon

texts.en:
Amon is 51 years old and is married, with eight children.  He owns a shop selling various goods, such as juice, soap, biscuits, cakes, etc.  Amon has five years' experience, and the hours of his business are from 6 am to 8 pm every day except on Sunday. He currently employs one person to help him.

Amon has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase various goods, such as lotions, soap, biscuits, etc., to sell.  With any profits from the loan, Amon would like to satisfy his family' basic needs and start saving for his future.  He will be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods, such as: juice, soap, biscuits, cakes, etc.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes tiene 49 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de 18 años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
La VRC la florida está conformada por 12 socios y socias esta ubicada en el Cantón Chillanes a 5 minutos de la oficina.
María se dedica al comercio de granos y harinas.
Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del tambo y Chillanes.
Solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería (granos), Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudará a mejorar la calidad de vida.
El sueño es poder verle al hijo que termine los estudios y llegue a ser profesional. Al desafía que se ha enfrentado a diario es la competencia.
En los tiempos libres le gusta descansar y disfrutar de las festividades de Santa Rita se considera una persona honesta, unida, trabajadora.
texts.en:
María Mercedes, 49, is married and has a son.  She lives with her husband and 16-year-old son in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.  

The “La Florida” communal bank has 12 members, both men and women, and is located in Chillanes Canton 5 minutes from the office.  María is a grains and flour merchant.  Her purchases and her sales take place in San José del Tambo and in Chillanes.

She asks for the loan to buy grains.  With help from the loan she will improve her quality of life.  Her dream is to see her son complete his schooling and become a professional.  The challenge she has faced daily is competition.  In her free time she likes to rest and enjoy the Saint Rita festivities.  She considers herself to be an honest, united and hardworking person.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Lilia Ines

texts.es: La señora Lilia a sus 56 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de mercancía relacionada con productos y accesorios femeninos para el arreglo personal. La señora Lilia se ha dedicado a este oficio por muchos años de su vida, con esta actividad ha podido llevar los gastos propios y los de dos nietas que tiene a su cargo, ya que la señora Lilia no cuenta con el apoyo de ninguno de sus 4 hijos.  La señora Lilia desea comprar mercancía relacionada con productos de navidad, con el fin de que su pequeño negocio este más surtido y acorde a la época de fin de año. Con lo anterior, la señora Lilia podrá aumentar sus ingresos y de esta forma aumentar la calidad de vida de ella y sus dos nietas. El sueño de la señora Lilia es tener su propio almacén y salir adelante luego de haber sufrido un preinfarto que le ocasionó la perdida del 60 % (porciento) del habla.
texts.en: Mrs. Lilia is 56 years old and sells all kinds of women's accessories and personal care products.  She has been in business for several years and it has allowed her to cover her own expenses as well as those of her two granddaughters who she cares for.  Lilia receives no support from any of her four children.  Lilia wants to buy products related to Christmas so her small business is better stocked for the New Year season.  This will help increase her income and improve her and her granddaughters' quality of life.  Lilia's goal is to have her own shop and get ahead after having suffered a stroke that caused a loss of 60% of her speaking ability.

loans.use: To buy Christmas related products.

loans.name: Morozova

texts.en:
Morozova is 58 years old and lives with her husband, daughter and grandson in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. 

Her husband is retired, her daughter helps with her business and her grandson is a school student. She started her grocery retail business in 1990 by renting a counter in a market. Her business is the only income in the family and is not quite enough to support them all.

Now that her children are grown up, she wishes to expand her business. She is requesting 3,800,000 MNT to buy more goods. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "We're starting to have family crisis, I need to take action in order to protect our only income".

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Bidossessi Group

texts.fr: Le groupement BIDOSSESSI est composé de quinze personnes qui résident dans la même région. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Martine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Martine est âgée de 46 ans et vit au Bénin. Martine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Martine est une veuve et n’a aucun enfant. Cependant, Martine a deux enfants à charge. Pour subvenir à ses divers besoins et à ceux des enfants à charge, Martine vend depuis une trentaine d’année, de la farine de manioc, et du maïs dans une ville du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Martine vend de la boisson locale. Martine s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Martine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement BIDOSESSI, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The group BIDOSSESSI is made up of fifteen people who live in the same area. This is the second time that the group has asked for financial aid from Alidé, in order to increase their activity levels. The representative of the group, named Martine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Martine is forty-six years old and lives in Benin. Martine did not attend school. Martine is a widow and doesn't have any children. However, Martine is taking care of two children. In order to provide for her various needs and those of the children in her care, Martine has sold flour, manioc, and corn for around thirty years in a city in Benin. Additionally, she sells local drinks. Martine stocks up in her area. In striving to satisfy her clients and to increase her turnover and her revenues, Martine is asking with the other members of the group BIDOSSESSI for a second loan from Alidé. Their first loan has been paid off.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn.

loans.name: Ma Jelleza

texts.en:
Ma Jelleza is from the village of Cabatuan, Calabayan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Ma Jelleza is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, she is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2007, Ma Jelleza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees and supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Mruu

texts.en:
Mruu is a 25-year-old married man. He has two children aged two and five. He describes himself as honest and determined. 
Mruu operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, margarine, etc. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located at a potential and conducive area for a retail shop. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. Mruu will use the loan of 20,000 KES to purchase more sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, etc. His business goal is to be  a wholesaler within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy stocks of sugar, maize, flour, wheat flour, etc.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is applying for another loan to expand her samosa business. She will use this 50,000 Kes loan to purchase bales of wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. In the future, Mwanaisha aspires to continue improving her enterprise.

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mwanaisha has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase bales of wheat flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Silyvia's Group

texts.en:
Silyvia's Group comprises six hardworking young women. Silyvia is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past two years, Silyvia has been working hard to manage her small business of selling raw food. 

To help expand her business, Silyvia has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more raw food such as cassava and sweet potatoes for reselling. This will help Silyvia to generate greater profits and pay for the school fees for her young siblings. Silyvia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Silyvia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more raw food such as cassava and sweet potatoes for reselling.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.en:
Mariela is a young woman and has 26 years old, she is a hard working and capable woman, she has one child and he is the most important thing in her life.
