She was studying but she could not work because her baby was born and she thought it was best to wait until the baby grew up. She wanted to have a business and at the same time take care of the baby. She started to sell lunch near her house and obtained good results and now her demand has increased. To day, she needs your help to buy the raw material like glasses, cups and more, in order to grow up her business, increase her sales and offer a better services to her clients.

She is requesting a loan of US$ 375 to purchase raw materials and she offers to repay in 4 months at least.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Mariela es suna mujer joven de 26 años de edad, muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ella es madre de un niño de dos años de edad que es el motor de su vida. Ella estaba estudiando y al terminar su carrera nació su hijo por ese motivo tuvo que esperar a que creciera un poco su hijo para poder poner su negocio y de esa forma poder ayudarse y salir adelante, generando ingresos que le permitieran sostenerse junto con su hijo. En Noviembre del 2005 se quedó sola y empezó a vender almuerzos a las maestras de una escuela cercana y tuvo muy buena aceptación, motivo por el cual se incrementó su demanda incluso a solicitarle comidas y licuados y desde entonces su negocio ha estado creciendo.

Hoy solicita un crédito por $ 375 USD el cual piensa destinar una parte para la compra de materias primas que utiliza en la elaboración de sus desayunos y comidas, y la otra parte la piensa destinar a la compra de utensilios como platos, vasos, tazas, etc. Los cuales le ayudaran a brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El plazo que requiere para pagarlo es de 4-8 meses.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Born in 1961 in Kpalimé, Mrs. Anne T. is married and has two (02) children. Having neither had the chance to go to school nor to learn a profession, she quickly initiated herself in the charcoal business through her uncle's wife. As soon as she was married, she took up this business, which is very profitable for her and has helped her greatly in meeting the needs of her family, since her husband is unemployed and unable to deal with these responsibilities.

She has received two loans of $150 which she paid off without difficulty.

She is asking now for a loan of $800 which will allow her to stock charcoal in times of abundance and re-sell it at a slightly higher price when it is needed.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1961 à Kpalimé, Madame T. Anne est mariée et est mère de deux enfants. N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et n’ayant appris aucun métier, elle s’est vite initier au commerce du charbon de bois par la femme de son oncle. Aussitôt mariée, elle s’est lancée dans ce commerce qui lui est très rentable et qui l’a beaucoup aidé à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, car elle a un mari sans emploi et incapable de faire face à ses responsabilités.

Elle a reçu deux crédits de $150 qu’elle avait bien remboursés et sans difficulté.

Elle sollicite encore un financement de $800 qui lui permettra de stocker du charbon de bois au temps d’abondance et de les revendre un peu plus cher en temps de soudure.

loans.use: To buy, stock, and re-sell charcoal

loans.name: Amoin Edith

texts.en:
N. Amoin Edith is a 32-year-old woman with 3 children. She is the concubine of a bus driver who lost his job in 2006. Her clothes sales activities are the main financial resources for her family. She is very dynamic and is helping her husband to purchase a second-hand cab (taxi) in order to continue his activities with his own car.
Her first son is in grammar school and she works hard to help him get beyond the level where she was obliged to stop school because of the poverty of her family. N. Edith is very dynamic and ambitious and fights each day to pull her family out of the precarious situation they live in.

loans.use: Loan will be used to expand the business and diversify products offered.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his stock of local brown sugar

loans.name: Tarimai

texts.en:
Mrs. Tarimai Maharjan has a son who studies in grade 6. She lives in a single (i.e., not extended) family. Mrs. Maharjan and her husband Ananda Maharjan make traditional idols. Idol-making work is their traditional job. 
They make idols on order. In Nepal the demand for traditional idols is increased constantly. They have not enough money to invest in their work to meet demand. So they seek a loan fo US$ 375 to buy raw materials such as silver, gold, and wax  to use to make idols.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
We find Doris, in the company of her dear mother Gregoria, realizing her beautiful, colored, and elegant embroidered tapestries. She began creating this beautiful art two years ago, a trade she learned from her brother Walter. With the passing of time she perfected her embroidery technique that is now increasingly valued and asked for by the large number of clients. This enterprising and agile girl desires to continue expanding her products in the market. It is for this reason that she asks for a loan that she will invest in buying materials to continue embroidering and offering the best of her art. The economic benefits that she will obtain will provide her old and beloved mother with a better quality of life. At the moment, Doris hopes for your contribution so that she can continue to delight her select clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Andrew Tsavaris, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Encontramos a Doris, en compañía de su querida madre Gregoria, realizando sus hermosos, coloridos y elegantes cuadros bordados, ella incursionó en este bello arte desde hace dos años, oficio que aprendió de su hermano Walter y con el correr del tiempo fue perfeccionando su técnica de bordados y que ahora están siendo cada vez más cotizados por la gran cantidad de clientes y pedidos que alberga. Esta emprendedora y ágil muchacha desea seguir expandiendo sus productos en el mercado y es por esa razón que solicita un préstamo de dinero que invertirá en comprar materiales y materia prima para seguir bordando y ofreciendo lo mejor de su arte, con los beneficios económicos que obtenga brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su anciana y querida madre. En estos momentos Doris espera por tu colaboración para que siga deleitando con su bello arte a su selecta clientela.

loans.use: Purchase raw material to continue making her beautiful tapestries.

loans.name: San Juana

texts.es:
San Juana sells snack type items because it’s not necessary to dedicate much time and this allows her to have an extra source of income in addition to a full time salaried job that she works during morning hours. In the afternoons, she sets up a small locale outside her home to sell the snacks; and with these to two sources of income it’s easier to cover economic problems.

Now more than ever she needs higher sources of income as unfortunately 2 years ago one of her children suffered an accident that left after-effects, due to the accident he can’t stand for long periods of time. This is just one more motive for Mrs. San Juana to put more effort into her side business so she can pay her child’s expenses such as treatments. San Juana is asking for a $375 loan that she’ll pay back in 6 months. With this money San Juana will be able to buy merchandise and have new products to offer thus acquiring more income. With your help, San Juana will be able to help her son move past his accident and recuperate total mobility.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

San Juana se ha dedicado al negocio de snak porque no es necesario dedicarle todo el tiempo y esto le permite tener un ingreso extra, a parte de tener un empleo con sueldo fijo en el que trabaja por las mañanas y por las tardes pone un pequeño local fuera de su casa, es así que con los 2 ingresos le es más fácil solventar problemas económicos.

Ahora más que nunca necesita de mayores ingresos ya que desafortunadamente hace 2 años uno de sus hijos sufrió un accidente el cual le dejó secuelas y su hijo, debido al accidente no puede estar de pie por mucho tiempo, siendo esto un motivo mas para que la Señora San Juana le ponga mas empeño a su negocio para poder pagar los gastos de su hijo así como los tratamientos. San Juana está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero San Juana podrá comprar mercancía para poder tener nuevos productos que ofrecer y tener la oportunidad de adquirir nuevos ingresos. Con tu ayuda San Juana podrá ayudarle a su hijo para que éste salga delante de su accidente y pueda recuperar su movilidad total.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Doan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Doan Thi N., 57 years old, lives with her husband (a farmer) and her only son in Quang Xuong province. Her income is mainly from gardening and breeding animals, and Mrs. N. uses most of her loan from TYM Fund (Kiva's partner) on these. She always has a litter of pigs in her house (one litter after another). Often, she sells her pigs every three months and gets 500-700 USD. Her son is working to help pay for her weekly repayment. Her husband also helps out with her work and her repayment. With the support from her family, she intends to borrow 525 USD to buy more piglets because she just sold one litter of pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Doãn Thị Nhạn, 57 tuổi, sống cùng với cùng với chồng, một nông dân, và người con trai duy nhất tại Quảng Xương. Thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu từ trồng trọt và chăn nuôi, vì vậy phần lớn những đồng vốn vay từ Quỹ đều được chị sử dụng cho mục đích này. Trong chuồng nhà chị lúc nào cũng có một đàn lợn bán, lứa này lại có lứa khác thay thế. Bình thường khoảng 3 tháng chị Nhạn lại bán một lứa lợn cho thu nhập khoảng 500-700USD. Tiền hoàn trả hàng tuần do con chị đi làm trả. Chồng chị cũng phụ giúp chị trong công việc gia đình cũng như hoàn trả tuần. Với sự ủng hộ từ phía gia đình, vòng vốn này chị Nhạn xin vay 525USD để mua lợn con thay cho lứa lợn vừa bán.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Norma's Group

texts.en:
Lourdes, Norma, and Paola are members of the community bank “Lila”. Lourdes and Norma have belonged to the bank for three years, while Paola joined one year ago. In that time they have learned to be responsible, punctual, how to avoid getting sick, and the importance of saving.

Lourdes is 36 years old, is married, and has three children. Lourdes sells cosmetics from a catalogue. She sells Unique, Avon, and Esica products, and concentrates on selling to her friends and family. In addition, Lourdes transports shoes from the city of Trujillo, to sell in Ayacucho.

Norma is 32 years old, is a single mother, and has two children. Norma sells fruits from a cart outside the Santa Clara market. Norma also raises chickens and pigs which she sells at the market in the small town of Quinua and to friends and neighbors.

On the other hand, Paola is 20 years old, and is studying nursing at the local university. In order to help pay for school, Paola makes typical breads such as “chapla”, which is similar to pita bread. She learned how to bake from her parents.

Lourdes, Norma, and Paola need loans of 600, 1000, and 1600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying perfume, beauty cream, shampoo, grapes, mangos, papaya, bananas, flour, oil, chickens, and pigs.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is that each associate has an interest earning savings account. Lourdes, Norma, and Paola plan to use their savings to invest in their businesses, open a cake shop, pay for their children’s education, and to finish university. Their dreams are to see their businesses prosper, help their children have a better life, and find a job as a nurse.

loans.use: To buy perfume, beauty cream, shampoo, grapes, mangos, papaya, bananas, flour, oil, chickens, and pigs.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a mother of forty years old and has two children who are currently schooling. She has been selling peanuts, white rice, beans, etc. for ten years now. She travels a lot to the northern parts of Ghana to buy her products.

Georgina wants to use her new loan to buy more bags of beans, bags of rice, and bags of peanuts so that she reduces her traveling days and also to prevent price hikes during the lean season from affecting her profits.

To help Georgina reduce medical costs and save more money, she has registered with the National Health Insurance Scheme to take care of her and the family’s medical bills.

She is a proud member of the group “Nyame Aseda” (meaning God’s Thanksgiving) which guarantees for each other to re-pay the loan from Sinapi.

In the photo, Georgina displays her products in a busy market.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of beans, and bags of peanuts

loans.name: Hatuju's Nguvukazi Group

texts.en:
Hatuju is a married woman with 3 children, ages 19,17, and 9 years old. Hatuju is a clothes seller. She started her business in 1997. Every day, she works from 8am to 5pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $62 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwajuma, Happy, Semeni, and Mary, who have businesses in onions sales, shop ownership, and selling clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Agwa

texts.en:
E. was born in1939; she is one of three wives married to a polygamist who passed away. She is a mother of five children, three below 15 years old. Her only daughter, who was married, died after a protracted illness, leaving behind three children that E. now care for. E. is not educated and due to poverty, hardship, and the death of her husband, she struggles to educate and clothe her children,  pay hospital bills or even provide them three square meals a day. 
E. joined GHAPE three years ago and has successfully repaid two loans, both of which she invested in buying goats and pigs and farming of cassava. The profit from these loans has helped to pay school fees and hospital bills and increased the size of her farm.
E. requests a loan to increase the size of her business by buying more pigs and goats and farming more cassava. Her business is going to succeed because there is a ready market for the animals and cassava. Due to her experience in this business, she is well known in her community for raising healthy animals and has a lot of customers who come from far and near.  
She plans to repay this loan in 18 months and the first installment repayment begins four months after disbursement.

loans.use: To buy pigs and goats and raise fowl.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa B. is married and has one daughter, who is already of age and is currently helping to attend to clients. Her business has a good location, in the center of market called “number 4,” a highly comercial zone near Rodríguez de Francia Avenue, at the cross of Battilana street. Teresa began with approximately 1,000,000 guaraníes ($250 USD) in capital, which has grown over time. Currently, she has a broad client base in an area that is very populated and busy.

She is withdrawing the loan to buy various items such as pullovers, jackets, quilts, and especially garments for children for the fall and winter season. She starts her day very early at 4am so that she can buy everything that she needs for her business.

One of her aspirations is to expand her business soon in terms of equipment and furniture for her own store, so she can offer a more comfortable and pleasant environment for her clients.

loans.use: To buy various items such as pullovers, jackets, quilts, and especially garments for children for the fall and winter season

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem V. is a farmer and grocer in Dambouk Kokaos Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Aside from these businesses, she is a pig breeder and a rice middleman. She is a hard working woman in the village. Because of her poor conditions, Mrs. Sem V. tries to work with different businesses in order to support herself.

Since her business as a rice middleman is going well, Mrs. Sem V. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to keep in stock and to then resell later at a better price.

She is a 56-year-old widow without any children. Last year, Mrs. Sem V. obtained a loan from AMK to start her grocery business. She has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy more rice to keep in stock and to resell later at a better price.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa Maria J. M. is 59 years old, and married. She has three children who are 31, 38, and 35 years old. Rosa's partner works in farming and husbandry, and her children are all employed. Rosa would like to use a loan as working capital to invest in inventory and therefore satisfy demand. Rosa raises pigs in her home, and has been in this business in Malpasillo for more than 36 years. She began her business out of a need for work, and to support her family. With this loan she can do just that.



 Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

su nombre es Rosa Maria J. M., su edad es de 59 años,  su estado civil es  casada, tiene 3 hijos sus edades son: 31, 38 y 35, el nivel de escolaridad de los hijos es que no estudian trabajan , su compañero de vida trabaja en agricultura y ganaderia, su proposito es con el credito es poder invertir en capital de trabajo, de esta menera tener un inventario capaz de satisfacer la demanda, su actividad economica es el destace de cerdo, en su casa de habitacion teniendo mas de 36 años de dedicarse a esta actividad,este esta ubicado en malpasillo, el tiempo que tiene de tener este negocio es de 36 años, el negocio inicio con la necesidad de tener un trabajo de en el caso de poder mantener a su famila teniendo este financiamneto podra realizar lo q ya se ha dicho.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta D. sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, brings home for processing and preserving, and then sends to the market at Bantama near Elmina. Benedicta has received a vocational education.  She is a single parent and has four children. Benedicta has been selling fish since 2000. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees and other utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to continue building her house.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Taing

texts.en: Mr. Taing V. is a farmer in Kour Khmuoch Cheing Village in Kampong Cham Province. He usually rents a piece of land to cultivate potatoes. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to rent a plot of land to grow potatoes. His wife, Mrs. Nan Soeng, helps him in the plantation. Mr. Taing V. is 41 years old and the father of two children who attend the local school. His wife is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To rent land

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a member of the Union II Village Bank. She is 50 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are independent, working professionals. She still supports her two younger children, who are currently getting their college degrees. 

Adelaida owns a bakery in the San Sebastian neighborhood of the city of Ayacucho. She is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy more flour and other materials to make chapla (a traditional local bread) and to pay for some personal expenses for her children. She is a long-time client of FINCA Peru, and says that the organization has helped her get out of a lot of tough situations over the nine years she has been working with them. This will be Adelaida’s second Kiva loan. 

Adelaida dreams of being able to take some time off of work to rest and take a little vacation with her husband.

loans.use: Buy flour

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Mrs. Cecilia B., 40, is married and lives in Talisay, Dapitan City. She has three children, two of whom are in college and one in high school. Her husband is a motorcycle driver. From her desire to help her husband, she engaged in dried fish vending starting up with a capital of 3,000 PHP. It has operated for six years already.

Now, she is planning to borrow 6,000 PHP from Paglaum MP Cooperative, of which she became a member in May 2008. She displays her dried fish in her sister’s store from Mondays to Saturdays and Sunday in public areas on market day. 

Mrs. B., wanted to purchase a motorcycle of their own because her husband only rents a motorcycle. She also wants to have a stall in the public market to display her dried fish. Someday she will be happy seeing her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase cavans of dried fish.

loans.name: Mrs. Arn Men Village Bank Group

texts.en:
11 people in Thlouk Vien village in Kampong Chhnang province have formed a village bank loan, and Mrs. Arn M. is the village bank president.  She sells firewood, and her husband, Mr. Suos Dean, is a farmer who owns one-hectar field of land to cultivate rice.  In addition to his plantation, he is also chicken breeder.  Since his chicken breeding business has been successful, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Arn M. decided to request a loan to buy more chickens for breeding. She is 61 years old, and the mother of a child that works as a farmer.

Five members in this group have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start making payments several months before the end of their loan term, and almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for breeding

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua E. sells groceries and other food supplies, at Nyankumasi near Cape Coast. Akua received a primary education, but unfortunately had to stop. She is married, and currently has two children. Her husband works as a trader. Akua has been vending groceries and other food supplies since 2005. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying for the rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses. Akua plans to use her loan to purchase more groceries, rice, cartons of cooking oil, and other food items to meet the increased demands of her customers. She hopes to use these profits to reinvest for expansion and increase the reach of her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more groceries and bags of rice, cattons of cooking oil and other food items for sale and also for the preparation of food for sale to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Ruziniso

texts.en:
Ruziniso Y., 46, has raised two children with her husband, and for 15 years has worked in the city’s largest local market selling rice, wheat and vegetables subject to the season. The business is very stable and generates the main income for the family as her husband is retired on a pension. Ruziniso has been working with IMON for three years and has proven to be a reliable client. Today she is requesting $900 for the term of 12 months in order to purchase wheat and rice to sell. Ruziniso thanks all for their support and promises to pay the loan in time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, including being a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, and Mavlavi Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase wheat and rice to sell.

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.ru: Мирзоев Исматулло проживает в Гиссарском районе. Возраст 37 лет , женат и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Работает на центральном рынке района. Торгует одеждой , которую привозит из города Душанбе. Опыт в бизнесе уже 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 9 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ismatullo M. lives in the Gissar region. He is 37 years old, married and has three children. He has secondary education. He works on the central market of the region. He sells clothing which he brings in from Dushanbe. His experience is ten years in this business. He plans to use the loan to increase his commodity circulation.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Taape

texts.en: Taape F., 39, is married with 1 child. She has 1 year of experience in the banana chip business. She sells to the general public and villagers 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 tala (~104 USD). SPBD loans are Taape’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. The loan will only be used for the business.

loans.use: To purchase a stove, drippings, plastic bags, and bunches of bananas for making chips

loans.name: Milciades Vera

texts.es: El cliente es un conocido mecanico de motos. Trabaja en local propio en una de las principales avenida de San Ignacio. El esta casado con la Sra. Dora Villasanti y tienen 2 hijos menores.  Su conyuge posee una peluqueria. Destinó el préstamo para comprar materiales a ser utilizados en el taller de motos, de esta forma abarata el costo y consigue mayor margen en su actividad.
texts.en:
This client is a well-known motorcycle repairman. He works in his own business space on one of San Ignacio’s main avenues. He is married to Mrs. Dora Villasanti, and they have 2 young children. His wife owns a hair salon. The loan was used to purchase materials that he will use in his motorcycle repair shop so that he can lower costs and boost profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 30 años, vive con su pareja con la que tiene 2 hijos, gracias a su trabajo y al de su esposo, como albañil, la casa donde viven es propia. Ella es una mujer muy activa y con deseos de superación, por lo que se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de productos de belleza de una línea cosmética muy conocida a nivel nacional. Debido a su buena atención y amabilidad con las que trata a su clientela, esta va en aumento. A Maria le gusta mucho su trabajo porque se entretiene, y además le es muy rentable, con cuyas ganancias puede sostener, en comunión con su esposo, los gastos de su hogar. Con MFP, ya tiene 5 créditos y le encanta trabajar con su banco comunal porque los integrantes son responsables y solidarios unos con otros. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más productos de belleza y una vitrina para exhibir sus productos y guardarlos con seguridad.
texts.en:
Maria, 30, lives with her husband and their two children. Thanks to her work and that of her husband, a bricklayer, the house where they live is their own. She is a very active woman with the desire for self-improvement. For the past year she has been selling beauty products from a nationally well known line of cosmetics. She treats her customers with good attention and friendliness. Because of this she is getting more customers. Maria likes her work very much because it is fun and also very profitable. With her earnings, and those of her husband, they can keep up with the household expenses. She now has five loans with MFP. She really likes working with her community bank because the members are responsible and supportive of each other. The loan is to buy more beauty products and a display case to show her products and keep them safe.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise and buy a display case

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort A. sells frozen fish and meat in Abura. Comfort has been educated through junior high school.  She is married and has three children. Comfort has been selling fish and meat for ten years. She is responsible for feeding and clothing her family. Her loan will be used to buy fish and meat, store them in a freezer and then resell. She intends to reinvest the profits into her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish and meat to sell.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred N. was born in 1988 and married while still quite young to a man who works as a mechanic in Likoni, Mombasa. They are blessed with one school-age child. N. went into business last year as supplier of industrial chemicals used in making detergents such as soap. She has applied for a loan for $600 to improver her business.

loans.use: To buy more industrial detergents.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem M., 44, is married and has three school-aged children. She lives in a village approximately thirty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

M. has ben involved in the agriculture sector as a rice-field farmer and pig-raiser since she was rescued from the genocide regime in 1979. Her husband is a farmer as well, and they both typically make an income of US$4 per day.

Because her primary income is generated from agriculture, she has requested a loan of US$1,000 to purchase fertilizer and gasoline to enable her farmland to achieve its maximum output. By doing this, she hopes that her family’s standard of living will be gradually changed and improved.

M.'s husband is shown in the photo with pigs they have raised.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline for her farming business

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère d’un enfant,  elle réside avec sa famille dans le quartier d’awatamé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. Elle a appris le métier de la couture et a ouvert son atelier qu’elle a nommé «  la main de Dieu ». Elle a associé à cette activité le commerce de pagnes et ce commerce marche bien pour elle, aussi elle confectionne des habits qu'elle vend à ses clients. Elle veut  agrandir le commerce de pagnes et de tissus, raison pour laquelle elle demande de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 30 pagnes de nouvelles qualités
texts.en:
This lady is married and the mother of one child. She lives with her family in the Awatamé district, an outlying neighborhood of the city of Lomé. She learned to be a seamstress and opened her own workshop that she named « la main de Dieu » [God's hand].

Along with sewing, she also sells "pagnes" (brightly colored lengths of African print cloth). This business is going well for her, especially as she also sews outfits that she sells to her customers. She would like to expand her sales of "pagnes" and other fabrics, so she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 30 "pagnes" of new sorts.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes"

loans.name: Amivi Julienne

texts.fr:
cette dame exerce depuis 2001 à Adidogomé le commerce de charbon de bois, elle dispose d'une clientèle élevée. son stock de marchandises a connu une baisse. pour maintenir sa clientèle, elle veut vite se réapprovisionner et sollicite auprès de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 25 sacs de charbons de bois et assurer le transport.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
Since 2001, this woman has been doing commerce in charcoal.  She has a large number of customers.  Her stock of merchandise has experienced a drop.  To maintain her customer base, she wants to stock up again quickly and is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 25 sacks of charcoal and to ensure their transport.  She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La señora Norma L. tiene 48 años de edad, esta casada desde hace varios años con el señor Arsenio Caceres y viven en su casa propia que esta situada en el Barrio Arroyo Pora Vivienda del distrito de Cambyreta.

La señora Norma se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la venta de prendas de vestir de manera independiente, posee buena mercaderia y cuenta con una buena clientela que siempre compra sus prendas, ya que desde hace tiempo que se dedica a este rubro. Gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido mantener a su familia y cubrir todos los gastos del hogar. 

Ella hoy dia esta solicitando el credito para la compra de mas mercaderias, ya que cuenta con muchos clientes que constantemente compran de ella. El monto que solicita es de Gs. 2.000.000.

loans.use: Compra de prendas de vestir, tales como: pantalones vaqueros, poleras, sueters, camperas, y otros.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en: Princess K. A. is 63 years old and she is a widow with four children. She sells provisions like cartons of milk and drinks and this is her main source of income. She hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Khamisa

texts.en:
Khamisa J. is currently in the business of selling bread  and is requesting a loan to purchase more bread to sell.  Khamisa is 30 years old and is Married with a husband that is a driver. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Rubidia Isabel

texts.es: Rubidia Isabel V. D. M. D. 41 años D. edad resiD. en Ciudad Arce departamento La Libertad, vive con su esposo y su hija D. 22 años quien estudia.  Rubidia tiene una tienda D. consumo con 15 años D. experiencia en el negocio, el crédito que solicita Rubidia es para invertir en su negocio  el cual necesita D. variedad D. productos para ofrecer  a sus clientes, vale mencionar que  Rubidia  ya había obtenido créditos anteriormente y todos sus pagos fueron puntuales cancelando su crédito antes D. la fecha.
texts.en:
Rubidia Isabel V. D. M., 41, lives in the city of Arce in the La Libertad department. She lives with her husband and her 22 year old daughter who goes to school. Rubidia has a convenience store, and she has 15 years of experience in this business. The loan that Rubidia is asking for is to buy a variety of products that her business needs to offer to her customers. Ribidia has had previous loans, and all of them were repaid before they were due.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Neris Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el mercado La Terminal del departamento de León, la señora Neris del Socorro B. se dedica arduamente a su actividad de venta de verduras como chiltomas, yuca, plátanos, limones, entre otros siendo este negocio el que le genera los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.

Hoy en día, la señora Neris acudió a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito porque necesita comprar las verduras para continuar ofreciéndolas en el mercado. Es importante destacar que ella es muy trabajadora porque a diario inicia la venta a las cuatro de la mañana y termina hasta el atardecer y a pesar que no cuenta con un local eficiente, ella se esfuerza para vender los perecederos en un canasto.
texts.en:
At the Terminal market in the department of León, Neris del Socorro B. works hard at her business, selling vegetables such as bell peppers, yucca, plantains, and limes, among others. This business generates the income that she brings home to the house where she lives. Currently, Neris is asking Ceprodel for a loan because she needs to buy vegetables in order to continue offering them at her stall. It is important to note that she is a very hardworking person: each day she starts selling her products at four in the morning and continues until sundown.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing vegetables

loans.name: Esta

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Esta M. from Mbozi. She is married with three children between the ages of four and 13. Esta has been running a shop since 2005. She owns a small duka or neighborhood shop in the city where she sells common household and grocery items.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, seven days per week.  Esta currently earns about 90 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to improve the quality and range of her products. In the future, she plans to open the same business at a new location. Esta thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To improve the quality and range of her products

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen V. is from the village of Santo Niño in Tukuran, a municipality of Zamboanga Del Sur province, Mindanao. She is 27 years old, separated from her spouse and has three school-aged children. Karen runs her own general store from which she sells products for daily use such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste to the local community. She has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Karen joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her fifth from GDMPC, of 10,000 PHP to be used to expand her business. Karen successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use all additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her general store.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Good Luck Group

texts.en: Janet is 31 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the people. She trades in charcoal and crates of eggs. Janet is the leader of a trust bank group called Good Luck. The members of the group are mainly into fishing business and other commercial activities. The group requests for a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. It is their desire to give their children the best of education they can afford.  Janet stands left in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and local alcohol at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Jane is 22 years old and is married to a policeman.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Fanis Fátima

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica en el departamento de León, la señora Fani G. ha sido una dama muy trabajadora y estudiante a la vez que ha logrado salir adelante por sus múltiples esfuerzos que ha realizado. Ella actualmente está terminando su carrera de arquitectura para optar a un buen empleo y así suplir las necesidades de su hogar compuesto por sus cuatro hijos.
Para terminar la carrera debe de realizar el pago de los módulos de estudio y para ello solicita un crédito para invertirlo en el pago de dichos módulos y así dar por concluida su carrera de arquitectura logrando así sus sueños de llegar a ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica in the department of León, Fani Gomez has been a hardworking woman and student who has managed to get ahead through the multiple efforts she has made. She currently is finishing her degree in architecture so that she can apply for a good job and in this way meet the needs of her household of 4 children. In order to finish the degree she must make payments for some additional course units and to do this she requests a loan that will be used to pay for these units. In this way she can finish her architecture degree and thus achieve her dream of becoming a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for course units at the university

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase food ingredients.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, tiene 41 años y es casada, ella forma parte del banco comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” de la Asociación Arariwa. Julia se dedica a la venta de comida como caldo de gallina y caldo de cabeza de cordero. Julia nos cuenta que compra dos a tres gallinas de sus vecinas para hacer sus caldos. Ya son varios años que se dedican al negocio y les ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Julia requiere el préstamo de los 500 soles, que invertirá en comprar mas gallinas para hacer mas platos de comida. Julia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

El distrito peruano de Huancarani es uno de los 6 distritos de la Provincia de Paucartambo, ubicada en el Departamento de Cusco, perteneciente a la Región Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Julia is 41 years old and is married. She is a member of the Asociación Arariwa’s “Once de Mayo – Huancarani” communal bank. Julia sells food, such as chicken soup and lamb’s head soup. Julia tells us she buys two or three chickens from her neighbors to make her soups. She has been in this business for several years and it has gone well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Julia needs a loan of 500 PEN, which she will use to buy more chickens for the food she makes. Julia is grateful for the opportunity provided through this program and she promises to repay in within the time frame. (The Peruvian district of Huancarani is one of the 6 districts in the province of Paucartambo, located in the department of Cusco. It belongs to Cusco Region, Peru.)

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Julia needs a loan of 500 PEN, which she will use to buy more chickens for the food she makes.

loans.name: Mbene

texts.fr: Mbène D. est une femme de 60 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de THILMAKHA depuis 8 ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 17 crédits qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficultés. Son activité est l'embouche ovine, elle achète les sujets dans les marchés, les engraisse pour les revendre au bout de 5 à 6 mois. Cette activité lui génère de ressources financières lui permettant de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mbène D. is a 60-year old woman who is married and has three children. She has been a member of the Village Bank in THILMAKHA for eight and a half years and has had 17 loans, which she has always repaid without any difficulty. Her activity is beef fattening; she buys her animals in markets and fattens them up to resell them after five or six months. This activity generates financial resources which allow her to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and sustain her activity

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 43-year-old married man with four children, all of whom attend school. To earn a living, he offers transportation services as a driver. His business is located in Kitengela, which is located in the outskirts of the city of Nairobi. He explains that he has been in this business for five years, and that he was previously employed as a mechanic before he started this business. To supplement his income, he also runs a retail shop. In general, he is a very hardworking person who is very dedicated to his family.

He hopes to generate more income in the future and to thereby improve his family's standard of living. As a result, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES ($275) to start another business. Specifically, he plans on selling clothes in his community.

loans.use: To embark on a new business venture by selling clothes

loans.name: Kazeem

texts.en: Kazeem is married and he is 32 years old. He is blessed with a child who gives him joy as a father. He lives in Oyo state, Nigeria. He sells medicines at retail prices to his customers.  He has been in this business for 10 years and he uses his experience in business to attract and retain more customers. He is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more medicines to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a hardworking and focused man who is married and blessed with two children who are in school.

Martin runs a butcher shop in his hometown to earn a living and has been in the business for five years. He is married to a business lady and, with the two businesses, they are able to support their family and pay school fees for their children.

Martin saves his money with his group in Faulu Kenya called Sinuka Kitengela which guarantees loans made to its members. He hopes to grow his business since he can access loans and this is his first loan. He has requested a loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to his stock of goats for slaughter.

Martin hopes to grow his business and open other outlets in the future.

loans.use: To add to his stock of goats for slaughter

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Mrs. Prum Y. is a 25-year-old resident of a rural community in Kompong Tom Province.  She works as a sewing laborer in a garment factory, a job she started when she was single. She is now married to Kimdat, a 30-year-old laborer in the same industry.  The couple have a young child who is already enrolled in school. Prum Y. will be using her loan to buy an old motorbike to supply her and her family with transportation to work and other places.

loans.use: To buy an old motorbike

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Danaya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fatiana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de condiments, de gâteaux, d’arachide et de poissons frais.
Ces femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments alimentaires, de l’arachide, des sacs de farine de blé et des poissons.                   
FATOUMATA D. du groupe Danaya (qui est en T-SHEET jaune) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de la farine de blé.
Elle s’approvisionne en farine de blé avec les commerçants de Nangola, après transformation en gâteaux, elle effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Nangola et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Danaya group are all married, are an average of 37 years old, have two children and live in traditional extended families in the village of Fatiana in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through family ties and are in the business of selling condiments, cakes, peanuts and fresh fish. The women of the Danaya group are on their first joint loan which will be used to buy condiments, peanuts, sacs of wheat flour, and fish. Fatouma D. of the Danaya group (in the yellow t-shirt) plans to use her loan to buy wheat flour. She gets her supplies of wheat flour from the traders in Nangola. After making it into cakes, she sells them from her home, at the market of Nangola, and in nearby markets, for cash and on credit, to a clientele of men and women. She plans to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA which will be used to meet the daily expenses of her family and the rest will be reinvested her business.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wheat flour

loans.name: Sarvar

texts.en:
K. Sarvar is dedicated to his agricultural business. Having little knowledge in the beginning, he had to learn a lot about farming. Now, he has acquired a fair experience in agriculture. Currently, Sarvar is very happy, for his two children are the motivation for his desire to grow his business. He approached IMON International to obtain a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to sow for a good harvest so that he can take care of his children and his home.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Hyrea

texts.en:
Hyrea B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 41 years old and has 5 school-aged children. Hyrea owns & operates an agricutural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Hyrea has been engaged in her business for over 15 years.

Hyrea joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Hyrea is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Hyrea from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Verónica Magalis

texts.es:
Verónica es una joven de 26 años, casada, con deseo de superación, trabaja como maestra, y sus ideales es poder seguir estudiando para mejorar su vida profesional, como personal.
 Su esposo trabaja como cajero y ambos están haciendo las mejoras a su casa, pequeña pero propia ya que con ayuda de los financiamientos ha logrado repellar su casa, ponerle cerámica, y ahora desea  comenzar a hacer su cocina lo que invertirá en la compra de piedra, un metro de arena, cemento, hiero, zinc, perlines para lograr mejor espacio y higiene en su hogar.
texts.en:
Verónica is a young, 26-year-old woman who is married and who desires to get ahead in life. She works as a teacher and her dream is to continue studying to improve her professional life as well as her personal life. Her husband works as a cashier and they are both doing home improvements. Their house is small but they have made it their own, since they have plastered it and installed ceramic tiles with the help of financing. Now they want to begin to build their kitchen. They will invest in the purchase of stone, cement, beams, iron, zinc and a cubic meter of sand to create more space and to improve hygiene in their home.

Translated from Spanish by David Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy construction materials to build her kitchen in order to have more space and to improve hygiene

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es: El Sr. Fausto tiene el rubro de plomero independiente,  su trabajo lo realiza por toda la zona sur y es muy conocido por su buen trabajo y responsabilidad , con la actividad que realiza mantiene su hogar ya asume todos los gastos ya que es el único que tiene ingresos ya que la esposa no trabaja y los hijos estudian por todo lo mencionado don fausto califica para tasa Kiva, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara para la compra de una computadora para su hijos ya que la necesitan para que les ayude en sus estudios, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Mr. Fausto works as an independent plumber; he works in the entire southern zone and is well known because of his quality work and responsibility. With his work, he supports his home and assumes all household expenses since he is the only one with an income; his wife does not work and the children go to school. For all these reasons, Mr. Fausto qualifies for a Kiva loan; the money from the loan will be used to buy a computer for his children since they need it to help them with their schoolwork. He is very grateful with Emprender and Kiva for the trust and the granting of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a computer

loans.name: Concepcion Group

texts.es:
El grupo Concepción está conformado por 3 mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras, su coordinadora Alma Nubia M. C. tiene 26 años de experiencia en la compra/venta de zapatos, actualmente tiene un tramo en el mercado de Masaya y su meta es tener una gran tienda con zapatos de todos los estilos y a un buen precio.

En éste grupo, Gladis V. R. también se dedica a la venta de zapatos, sin embargo ella realiza esta actividad en su casa de habitación ofreciéndolos en su mayoría al crédito a la gente de la comunidad, personas conocidas y recomendadas por sus familiares. La última integrante, Rosa Argentina S. O., tiene una actividad distinta a la de sus compañeras, pero no menos lucrativa, ella se dedica a la venta de fritangas; su puesto se encuentra en su casa de habitación y atiende principalmente por las noches y fines de semana. Todas ellas destinarán el crédito a la compra de mercadería y/o materia prima para seguir aumentando su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
The Concepción group is comprised of 3 hardworking, enterprising women. Their coordinator is Alma Nubia M. C., who has 26 years of experience buying and selling shoes. Currently she has a stand in the Masaya market and her goal is to have a big shoe store with all styles at a good price. In this group Gladis V. R. also sells shoes, however she works in her house, offering credit to the people of the community, persons known to her and vouched for by others. The third member, Rosa Argentina S. O., works in a different, but no less lucrative field than her partners. She sells fried foods from her house, mostly at night and on the weekend. All three women will use the loan to buy merchandise and/or primary ingredients to continue growing their working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has been operating her vegetable stall for the last eight years, selling at retail prices to local customers, especially neighbors and passersby. Saumu faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major aim is to become a shopkeeper in the future.

She decided to work with Yehu because of its easy policies and procedures. With the 30,000 KES loan she wants to purchase bananas, tomatoes and oranges to sell. She sells fried fish as another source of income.

loans.use: To purchase bananas, tomatoes and oranges.

loans.name: Jiji

texts.en: Jiji A. is from the village of Lunao, Gingoog City. She is 32 years old. Jiji is married. To make a living, Jiji owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Jiji has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Jiji joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jiji has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jiji is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Jiji from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Sorayda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SEÑOR PAN DE AZUCAR ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sorayda;   ella tiene 43 años de edad, es casada; y tiene 2 hijos,  La socia se dedica a la venta de maíz, ella compra al por mayor maíz y lo vende al por menor en el mercado central, ella  trabaja comprando a los proveedores mayoristas maíz y lleva a vender al mercado en la sección granos secos, ella vende todo tipo de maíz. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz en variedad y vender.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sorayda is a member of the “SEÑOR PAN DE AZUCAR” (Lord Bread of Sugar) communal bank, located in the Huanchac district, in the province and department of Cusco.  She is 42 years old and the single mother of two children.

[Sorayda] is 43 years old, is married, and has two children.  She buys corn in bulk from major suppliers and resells it in the dried grain section of the central market.  She sells all types of corn.

She is asking for this loan in order a variety of types of corn.  She is grateful and values the loan facilitated in this manner and promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Corn for resale

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.en: Claudine is 30 years old. she is married and has two children aged four and seven. One of her children goes to school. Her husband works as a rock extractor. Claudine is the leader of a borrowing group called Tuzamurane Group. Tuzamurane means "rise together" in English. Claudine sells various items such as sugar, rice, and cooking oil. She has been in this business for four years. With this loan, she will buy more sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell. With the profit from the business, she will save money. Her business is booming because she provides good customer service. In the future, she would like to own a big shop where all the people can buy from her.  In the photo, Claudine is on the second row holding a blue notebook.

loans.use: To buy more rice and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio Santa María Conavi surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación. 
Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser : venta de comidas, almacén,  despensa, lavandería, venta de frutas y verduras , venta de ropas v, venta de cosméticos, Manualidades.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Mariela quien se dedica  a la venta de lencería, ella se encuentra satisfecha con su grupo y quiere seguir trabajando, ya que el crédito la ayuda para algunos gastos y compra de mercaderías.
Es una mujer trabajadora y talentosa, realiza varios trabajos diariamente en su casa y también fuera de ella con el fin de ayudar a mi familia.
Actualmente decidió  invertir en la venta de lencería, cosméticos, perfumes para lo que solicita el préstamo.
Ella desea ofrecer estos productos en sus tiempos libre a conocidos, vecinos, amigos, y otros para comenzar.
Espera que el nuevo negocio le resulte bien y agradece por la ayuda créditicia.
texts.en:
Tis group from  the Santa María Conavi neighborhood began when one of the members had contact with the Foundation.  All of the women do different activities such as:  selling food, a store, a convenience store, a laundry, selling fruits and vegetables, seling clothes, selling cosmetics, artisan crafts. 

One of the members is Mariela, who sells lingerie. She is satisfied in this group and wants to keep working, since the credit helps her with some expenses and to buy merchandise.  

She is a hardworking and talented woman. She performs several tasks every day inside and outside of her house in order to help her family.  At present, she has decided to invest in selling lingerie, cosmetics, and perfumes, for which she is asking for the loan. 

She wants to offer these products in her free time to acquaintances, neighbors, friends and others to start. She hopes that the new business will go well and she is grateful for the lending help.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ayawoa Gbodzidi

texts.fr: Ayawoa a 33 ans,  mariée et mère de  2 enfants. Elle  a sollicité plusieurs crédits  qui ont été remboursés.  Elle exerce comme activité génératrices de revenus la vente d’ananas et de maïs et cumule près de 2 ans dans cette activité. Elle s’approvisionne à azahun et kovié  et revend ensuite  au marché local d’assiyéyé. L’objet de ce prêt  sera destiné à l’achat de 12 paniés d’ananas et 10 sacs de maïs pour répondre au mieux à la clientèle.

loans.use: achat d'ananas et maïs

loans.name: Dalberto Bayron

texts.es:
Dalberto Bayron C. P. tiene 22 años. Es soltero con la madre y un hermano, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No  Tiene  hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Dalberto se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 3 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en: Dalberto Bayron C. P. is 22 years old. He is single and, with his mother and one brother, lives in the region of Ventanas in the Los Ríos Province. He doesn't have children. The members of the VRC EI LA UNION are located in the Aguas Frías precinct, which belongs to the Ventanas region. This communal bank works at agricultural activities and during the season sows maize, rice, and beans. The members have been doing this activity for a long time. Dalberto has worked in agriculture, namely maize, rice, and beans, for 3 years. He purchases his products in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market and in the same precinct. He is seeking this loan to purchase agricultural inputs and fertilisers for his crops. The support of the loan will help him economically to supplement his necessities. He faces challenges such as plagues and diseases and a variable climate. Dalberto's dream is to purchase a house. He enjoys playing sport.

loans.use: Agricultural inputs and fertilisers

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix, de 61 años, es un hombre muy amable y humilde, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Justina de 59 años y su hijo menor Jhony de 17 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo que realiza Félix es el cultivo de cacao, café y hojas de coca, todas las mañanas junto a su esposa comienza sus días cultivando y regando sus tierras. Los ánimos que posee lo ayudan mucho en esta labor, ya que es una actividad que necesita de esfuerzo físico, pero él sabe que ningún esfuerzo esta de más con tal de brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, ya que siente que los meses de trabajo lo están recompensando. Lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, que es donde vende sus productos. Con el tiempo, desea juntar el dinero necesario para comprarse nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte lo ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su trabajo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas, ya que desea mejorar la productividad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Félix, age 61, is a very kind and humble man.  He lives in his own house with his wife, 59 year old Justina, and his youngest child, 17 year old Jhony.  He wishes to give them a better quality of life.

Félix grows cacao, coffee, and coca leaves.  Every morning he and his wife start their days cultivating and watering their land.  The energy that they have helps them a lot in their work.  This is an activity that requires physical effort.  However, he knows that no effort is too much in order to give his family the best.

What he likes best about his work is harvesting his products.  He feels that the months of work are rewarding him.  He has been doing this work for 40 years.  The most difficult part is transporting his crops to the city of San Francisco where he sells his products.  In time he wants to get together the money he needs to buy more land.  He wants more land to be able to increase his production.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He knows that this loan will help a lot in the progress of his work.  He will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy fertilizer and insecticide.  He wants to improve the productivity of his land.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 36 años y vive en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 2 años vende cosméticos y productos de lencería y los lleva a vender ofreciendo de casa en casa de sus amigos y familiares; dejando a crédito la mercadería vendida. Siempre mantiene el orden en sus cuentas de esa manera no descuida de la gente que debe pagarle. se ha fijado metas para el futuro ya que  su negocio le ha traído buenas ganancias, es por ello que desea tener más mercadería para abastecer su negocio, así podrá captar más clientes. Es su crédito número 3 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería.
texts.en: Cecilia is 36 years old and lives at home with her parents.  For more than two years, she has been selling cosmetics and lingerie.  She sells her products door-to-door offering them to her friends and family and leaving the goods sold on credit. She always keeps her accounts in order so that she doesn’t forget the customers who must pay her.  As her business has been profitable, she has set goals for the future. She wants to stock her business with more merchandise so she will be able to attract more customers.  This is her third loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and in addition, she is pleased to be a member of her communal bank because all of the members are people that she knows and they are responsible and very supportive.  She is grateful to all the people who will be managing her credit request as the loan will be very useful in advancing her business.  She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise.

loans.use: To buy more lingerie to stock her business.

loans.name: Jose Joaquin

texts.es:
José Joaquín tiene 37 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, donde posee casa propia y vive junto a su madre, está soltero y se dedica a la venta y reparación de bicicletas y helados, este negocio tiene aproximadamente 15 años de existir y ha ido mejorando con el tiempo, él ya tiene  experiencia en el manejo de este negocio.
A José se le ha presentado la oportunidad de obtener un lote de bicicletas nuevas para comercializarlas pero no cuenta con la cantidad de dinero que valen estas bicicletas, por lo que solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra, este préstamo será la oportunidad para crecer en el negocio ya que podrá ofrecer a sus clientes diferentes modelos para todos los gustos, además de fortalecer su inventario.
Su proyección es seguir en desarrollo con el negocio, ofrecer bicicletas de calidad y con estilos nuevos, atender bien a sus clientes y ser más competente.
texts.en:
José Joaquín is 37 years old.  He lives in El Transito, in San Miguel department where he owns his own home and lives together with his mother.  He is single and his business is selling and repairing bicycles.  He has been in this business for approximately 15 years and it has improved over time.  He has experience running his business.

José has the opportunity of obtaining a set of new bicycles to sell but he doesn't have the money to buy them.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to make the purchase.  This loan will be an opportunity for him to grow in his business since he will be able to offer his customers different models of bicycle to suit all tastes.  It will also strengthen his inventory.

José's plans are to continue developing his business, to offer good-quality bicycles in new styles, to serve his customers well and to be more proficient in his business.

loans.use: To buy a set of bicycles

loans.name: Dolores Paulina

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Bosques  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, conocida desde hace muchos años como la Ciudad Del Valle  encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Emprendedora de los Bosques.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Dolores, ella tiene 57 años de edad y hace varios años su compañero de toda su vida falleció y quedo sola con sus tres hijos que ya en la actualidad son mayores de edad. Su hija menor vive con ella. Hace poco trabajó como empleada publica pero hace un tiempo atrás dejo de laborar en este campo y  se dedicó al comercio.
 
Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y  también entrega en su casa lugar hasta donde sus clientes se acercan cuando llega mercadería nueva, su hija le ayuda en su negocio. Trabaja todos los días en las tardes, deja  a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar  cada quince días a  Guayaquil. Dice que lleva varios años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para comprar  ropa más que todo ropa de mujer, pantalones, blusas, camisetas, entre otras prendas. Este es el cuarto ciclo  en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que le brinda la institución. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the citadel of Los Bosques in the city of Portoviejo, a beautiful city with green mountains and enchanting landscapes known for many years as the City of the Valley, we find the place where every 2 weeks the members of the Emprendedora de los Bosques Communal Bank meet.

Here we meet Mrs. Dolores, she is 57 years old and a few years ago her lifelong partner passed away and she was left alone with her three children who at present are adults. Her youngest daughter lives with her. A while ago she worked as a public worker but she left the field and began working in sales.

Mrs. Dolores works selling all types of clothing, she does her sales door to door and in her home where her customers go when there is new merchandize. Her daughter also helps her maintain the business. Mrs. Dolores works everyday in the evenings; she sells on credit to her customers and collects every two weeks. Mrs. Dolores buys her merchandize in Guayaquil every fifteen days.

This loan is to buy more clothing, mostly women’s, as well as pants, blouses, shirts, and other items. This is her fourth loan in the Communal Bank and she likes it because of the extra benefits that the institution gives her. Mrs. Dolores’ dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, shirts and women’s clothing in general.

loans.name: Las Mercedes I Group

texts.en:
The “Las Mercedes I” group is now in its eleventh loan cycle. It was started with the contact of one group member with Fundación Paraguaya. The group has been working with the loan foundation since 2009 and has managed to save 2,701,441 PYG.  

The group’s senior director is Ms. Josefina C.. She is married with two children and her husband is a public employee. For the past several years, Josefina has run a small general store in her house. She says that the credit given by the foundation helped her to buy merchandise for her store and she is very thankful to Fundación Paraguaya because she earns more income from her business now. All the women from this group are engaged in productive activities such as clothing sales, tailoring, etc.

loans.use: for group members to buy food, clothing, cloth and jewelry

loans.name: Remelina

texts.en:
Family ranks first in the life of Remelina U., 35. She reached college and uses all she learned from there and from the entrepreneurial training she receives as a community partner in CCT* to boost her business. She is married to Roy, the driver of a delivery truck. They have two children, who are both in elementary school. Their family came from the province of Bohol and now resides in Baseco, Manila.

Last year, Remelina saw a good business opportunity buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes. She then pushed through with this venture until today. Mainly, Remelina’s business is rug-making. She uses cheap raw materials to come up with nice rugs for sale. Aside from that, she also sells electronic load for mobile phones which is much in demand nowadays.
