With all these businesses Remelina earns around Php 10,000 per month.

Knowing that she’ll be needing more finances to help her grow her business, Remelina applies for a Php 21,000 loan. She will use this money to purchase raw materials necessary for rug-making. Also, part of the loan will go to the improvement of the family comfort room.

Financial needs such as medication for her ailing mother bother Remelina. But despite these struggles she knows she has to continue the operation of her business, since this will be one way which God will use to give them financial provision. Remelina is hopeful, knowing that soon she will be able to relocate the site of her store. More than anything, she desires to see her family grow closer to God and have a good life. She yearns to see her children surpass her and graduate from college.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: raw materials necessary for rug-making

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina es una mujer muy alegre y a demás responsable ella tiene dos hijos y están a su cargo. Hace 5 años que se dedica a brindar el servicio de procesamiento de maíz, dicha actividad la realiza de una manera permanente porque cuando comenzó a trabajar fue por razón que como madre comprometida y responsable decidió ayuda a los ingresos de la familia ya que tenía que sacar adelante a su hijo, ya que por las mañanas realizaba la lo quehaceres del hogar y por las tardes sale a vender sus diferentes productos. Actualmente solicita un financiamiento para brindar el mantenimiento de la maquina que utiliza. Su deseo es seguir esforzándose para que a sus hijos no les falte el pan de cada día
texts.en:
Reina is a cheerful woman who is responsible for her two dependent children. She has managed a business that provides corn processing services for more than five years. Being a committed and responsible mother, Reina decided to pursue this business full-time because she wanted to help with the family income and help her child succeed. Every morning she completes her household chores and then sells her various products in the afternoon.

Reina is currently requesting a loan so that she can maintain the machine she uses for her business. Her wish is to continue striving forward so that her children are not lacking in their daily needs.

loans.use: Operating capital to maintain her equipment

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 34  ans, 3 enfants et vivent proportionnellement dans des familles nucléaires et  traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Belenikoro, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’articles divers. Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter de savons, beurre de karité, des habits, des chaussures et de la farine de blé.                                                                                                                                                                                                     
MARIAM C. compte acheter des savons de fabrication locale (Gabacourouni) avec les fabricants de la ville de Fana.  Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 5 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguisseme group are all married, and average 34 years of age and three children. They live in nuclear and extended traditional families in Belenikoro, a village in the Fana sub-prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got acquainted through bonds of kinship, neighborhood and friendship. They trade in various items. The women of the group are seeking their second group loan, to be used to buy soaps, shea butter, clothes, shoes, and wheat flour.

MARIAM C. intends to buy locally made soaps (Gabacourouni) from producers in the town of Fana. She sells daily in the village, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 5'000 (ca US$ 10), to be used to repay the loan, while the remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy locally made soap

loans.name: Heberardo

texts.es:
Heberardo tiene 21 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo. Vive junto a su familia en el  Distrito de Tambogrande ubicado en el departamento de Piura, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace más de diez años, el cuenta con un terreno agrícola en el cual suele sembrar todo tipo de granos, de sus cosechas y la venta de las mismas depende el sostenimiento económico de su familia por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para mantener sus cultivos de la mejor manera.

En esta ocasión el ha sembrado maíz y se encuentra trabajando arduamente para lograr que su cultivo brinde una buena cosecha, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la adquisición de fertilizantes que le permitan brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo.

Heberardo  es un hombre bastante entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive sus familiares y vecinos le consideran una persona responsable y bastante trabajadora.
texts.en:
Heberardo is 21 years old, has a partner and 1 child. He lives with his family in the Tambogrande District, Piura Department, located 4 hours from the capital, Chiclayo, of the Lambayeque Department.

He has been doing agricultural work for more than 10 years. He depends on the farmland that has all types of grain crops to financially support his family. He always tries his hardest to maintain his crops the best that they can be.

During this season he has planted corn and has been working very hard to have a good crop. For these reasons he is requesting Edpyme Alternativa a 500 Perivuan Soles loan to buy fertilizers.

Heberardo is a very family oriented man. His biggest wish is to offer them a better standard of living. His family and neighbors consider him to be a very responsible and hardworking person.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Uy

texts.en: Uy B., 50, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells food in front of the factory, earning an income of about $20 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $30 on the other necessary expenses. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for family use.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is aged 56 and has been a farmer for the last 20 years and employing three farmhands in his farm in the Litein area of South Rift, Kenya. His farm produces tea and milk which he sells locally. He earns additional income from his teaching employment. He is married with four children aged between 24 and 19 years and all attending post-secondary education.

Mathew has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says improved milk production will be a good relief in provision of family meals since his employment income goes toward the education of the children which has proved quite expensive.

Mathew points to insufficiency of dairy feeds and storage facilities for the same as well as water as the major challenges. He however advocates for more training for farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dressmaking business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her dressmaking business.

Juliana has been in this business for 25 years. Juliana earns additional income from her sari-sari store.

Juliana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her dressmaking business

loans.name: Bevelyn

texts.en:
Bevelyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Bevelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Bevelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Bevelyn hopes to expand her business so that Bevelyn could give the needs of her children out from the profit she could gain.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Silvia Melania

texts.es: Silvia Melania comenzó su negocio hace unos 7 Años, vendiendo cosméticos y perfumería en general, luego empezó a laborar en una zona franca y ahí vendía sus productos y se extendió con ropa, y calzados, ahora tiene una mayor clientela ya que sus compañeras de trabajo son la mayoría de sus cliente, también su esposo ayuda en la comercialización de la mercadería. Tiene dos hijos menores de edad a su cargo y que junto a su esposo le enseñan a salir adelante para que su medio de vida mejore cada día. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de ropa, perfumes, sabanas, cremas, toallas, bolsos y calzado.
texts.en:
Silvia Melania set up her business seven years ago, selling cosmetics and perfumes.  She then started working in a free trade zone and sold her products there.  She extended her business, selling clothes and footwear, and now has a larger customer base as her work colleagues make up most of her customers.  Her husband also helps her to sell her merchandise.  Silvia has two dependent children in her care and, together with her husband, they are teaching them to get ahead and improve their life day to day.

Silvia needs this loan to buy clothes, perfume, sheets, creams, towels, bags and footwear.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes, sheets, creams, towels, bags and footwear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new tires and sprocket to provide better service

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; El banco pertenece al distrito D. Urubamba, Provincia D. Urubamba, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia; la socia nacio el año D. 1940; la socia es casada y tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son independientes;  La socia se dedica a la venta D. chicha y refrescos, la socia elabora en su casa chicha D. maíz, ella compra la chicha la prepara cn difrentes ingredientes que solo ela tiene la receta exsacta, la socia lleva a vender a las diferentes ferias y también prepara refresccos, la socia trabaja solo para comprar ella sus diferentes cositas como las D. consumo personal, pago D. algunos recibos D. luz o agua, pago D. limpieza publica, y otros pequeños gastos, la socia en esta ocasión requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra D. ingredientes, manzanas, canela, clavo D. olor, maíz morado, piña, limones entre otros; La socia desea invertir en la compra D. sus ingredientes para preparar sus refresaco y llevarlos a vender durante el mes. La socia requiere el prestamo para invertir en sus negocio minorista D. venta D. refrescos y chichas.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Tercer Mundo” (Third World) communal bank that belongs to Urubamba District, Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.

She was born in 1940, is married and has five children who are already independent.  She sells chicha (corn based beverage) and soft drinks.  She makes the corn based chicha at home.  She buys the chicha and then prepares it with various ingredients that only she knows the exact recipe for.  She takes it to sell at various street markets.  She also makes other beverages.  She works just to be able to buy herself the few little things she needs for her personal use, to pay some of her utilities like electricity or water or street cleaning and other small expenses.

On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy ingredients like apples, cinnamon, cloves, purple corn, pineapple and lemons, among others.  She wants to invest in the purchase of her ingredients to prepare her beverages and sell them during the month.  She needs the loan to invest in her retail beverage and chicha sales business.

She is satisfied and very grateful for the support provided and commits to repay her debts in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to invest in her soft drink and chicha sales business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina, aged 30, is married to Samuel, and they are blessed with one child.

She runs a beauty salon that has been in operation for one year. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 80,000.

This is her second loan with KADET Ltd. She will use the funds to buy hair chemicals and beauty products for sale.

She hopes to operate a beauty and fashion institute in the future.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and hair products.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily works hard to support her family. Emily is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Emily has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soft-drinks, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Emily has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Emily would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like soft-drinks, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Edhit Yobana

texts.es: La Sra. Edhit es madre soltera, tiene 02 hijos, la señora se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (azúcar, arroz, leche, aceite, etc.)  ya que cuenta con su propia tienda ubicada en su vivienda, ella es muy trabajadora y desea salir adelante es por eso que también realiza la crianza de animales para luego venderlos y así tener una entrada más en su economía; el crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería para tener más variedad en su negocio.  Su sueño de la Sra. Edhit es tener una gran tienda y lograr una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos. Ella está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Edhit is a single mother with two children. She sells groceries such as sugar, rice, milk, cooking oil etc., from her own store, located in her home.  

She is very hard-working, and wishes to move forward in her life. That's why she also raises livestock for sale, so as to have one more source of income. 

She is going to use the loan to buy merchandise, in order to have a greater variety of products in her business.

Edhit's dream is to have a big store and to achieve a better quality of life for her children. She is very thankful that her loan has been granted.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, in order to have a greater variety of products in her business.

loans.name: 3.13.77.thiệu Đô Group

texts.en:
Sơn is 37 years old and is married with three dependent children. She lives and works in Thiệu Đô district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Sơn works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase calves to raise and sell in future. Sơn has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Sơn faces in her business are natural disasters and droughts.

Sơn is the group leader of the 3.13.77 Thiệu Đô solidarity group, which consists of seven members. This is Sơn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Sơn hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Hard Work Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Hard Work” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 1,800,000 SLL. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Haja (pictured left) is the leader of this group. The 48-year-old is married and the couple has 6 children – 2 in secondary school, 1 in college and the others are no longer attending schools. Haja has been a businesswoman for many years now, she sells groundnuts etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy groundnuts etc. in a large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts etc. in a large quantity to sell in her business

loans.name: Ankhbayar

texts.en:
Ankhbayar is 43 year old and lives with his wife and four children. He works at Military Force as a guard in Dornod, a province of Mongolia. His oldest son is working as well and helping their parents.

They live all together in a small house which is in quite bad condition. His wife rents a place to sell meat. She has been doing this business for 8 years. Currently there is a need to increase the working capital of his wife's business as it is important for expanding the business in the future. And he has a plan to make adjustments to his house because it has been becoming quite old and uncomfortable to live in. Therefore, Ankhbayar is requesting a loan to purchase a large amount of meat from wholesalers for his wife’s business and also to repair their old house.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of meat from wholesalers for his wife’s business and to repair their old house

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells fresh foods in Masindi, Uganda. She is a 28-year-old married woman with two children. She dreams of educating her children and owning a big food stall. Grace intends to use the loan facility to buy oranges and pineapples to sell.

loans.use: to buy oranges and pineapples to sell.

loans.name: Seira

texts.en:
Seira is 43 years old and married with four children. For the past two years, she has owned and operated a business selling a variety of different products in the local community. Seira joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services and this will be her second loan. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. 

Seira is requesting a 1500 WST loan to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 800 WST or 333 USD per week) to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ndungu

texts.en:
Ndungu is a 32-year-old married man with four children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a taxi driver for ten years. He was formerly an employee and now has his own car. His vision is to buy another car and to educate his children.

Ndungu needs the loan to buy tires.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Night is a 28 years old business woman, who lives in Juba. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 8 and 3.  All of them go to school. 

Night runs a food store business, and she has been in the business for 4 years. She has no employees. Night heard about Finance Sudan through the fellow clients, she is taking a loan of 800 SDG to purchase more food items like green vegetables, lemons and small other things. In addition to this business, Night has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Night would like to hope for increment in the business size, at least to be selling beans and flours.  

Her major challenges include low income rate to increase the business.   

Night says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support. She wishes it to continue.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like green vegetables, lemons.

loans.name: Gardenia Edelmira

texts.es:
Gardenia de 39 de años, trabajo vendiendo comida porque era una buena cocinera y por necesidad de trabajar.

Trabaja todos los días y por lo general trabaja de 10 de la mañana y termina por la noche sin hora específica.

La dificultad del trabajo es la delincuencia ya que el sector en el que vive es muy peligroso. No está casada pero tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando en instituciones fiscales.

Su meta es terminar de construir su casa para poder vivir tranquilamente con sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Gardenia, age 39, works selling food because she is a good cook and needs to work.

She normally works every day, starting at 10:00 am and ending at different times every night.

Crime is a challenge for her business, because her neighbourhood is very dangerous. She is unmarried but has two children who are currently in public school.

Her goal is to finish building her home in order to live peacefully with her two children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Nat, 33, is a married mother of three dependent children. Her oldest son is a construction worker and her other two are still in school. Rice farming has been Nat's main income source for 10 years, supplemented by transplanting rice seedlings for others. Her husband is a construction worker. Nat currently earns more than US $5 per day. 

This $600 loan is Nat’s first with VisionFund and she will use it to buy fertilizer and a water pump for her farm. She hopes to grow healthy rice and to increase her yield.  She also hopes to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a water pump

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Molly

texts.en:
Molly is a 38-year-old single mother who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. In addition to her primary profession of teaching, she owns a shop and has been a farmer for the last ten years. In her business, she faces the challenges of price fluctuations, inflation, seasonal weather, and inadequate capital to purchase stock. She needs this loan in order to buy salt and maize flour to sell during this Christmas season.

Molly's personal goals are to educate her children and to live up to the standards of the changing economy. Her business goal is to expand her business into a big wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy salt and maize flour to sell during this Christmas season.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, 29, is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of a low number of customers during the months of March to June, while over the holidays the demand is high. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for the business.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en: Geofrey  is a 23-year-old single man. He has no children yet. He describes himself as confident and ambitious. He operates a carpentry retail store where he sells furnitures such as tables, wall units, sofa sets and beds. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenges to be a shortage of raw materials and insufficient funds for maintenance. He will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy timber worth 30,000 KES. His business goal is to engage himself in contractual carpentry work. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a plot.

loans.use: to buy timber for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Kakone Traders Group

texts.en: Joseph is a sixty-two-year-old married man with fifteen children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling fish for thirteen years and works six days a week and also has a salt business as an additional income source. Bad weather and inadequate capital are his challenges while his dreams are to start processing salt as he currently sells it in its original form direct from the lake. Joseph intends to use the loan to buy salt pans. He is a member of the above mentioned group where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy salt pans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margrate wants to buy animal feeds for her dairy cattle

loans.name: Komlan

texts.en:
Born in Momé on March 1, 1973, Komlan A. is married and the father of a family of four children. In addition to his children, he takes charge of two brothers and one sister in apprenticeship. With a secondary school education, Komlan A. has much experience in truck farming, which he has done for more than ten years. The profits from this business are a means for him to meet household expenses.

He now hopes to buy electric irrigation equipment to water his entire farm so that he can enlarge his garden. He asks for $1200 to realize his project that will help him to improve his cultivation practice and his family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

Né à Momé le 1er Mars 1973, Monsieur A. Komlan est marié et père d’une famille de quatre (04) enfants. Outres ces derniers, il compte en charge deux (02) frères et une sœur en apprentissage. Instruit de niveau secondaire, Monsieur A. Komlan possède une large expérience dans le maraîchage, qu’il fait depuis plus d’une dizaine d’années. C’est d’ailleurs les revenus de ce travail qui lui servent de moyen pour subvenir aux charges de son ménage.

Aujourd’hui, il espère acheter des machines électriques pour arrosage de tout son espace maraîcher afin de pouvoir agrandir son jardin. Il sollicite $1200 pour la réalisation de ce projet qui lui permettra d’améliorer ses pratiques culturales et les conditions de vie de toute sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Yorma

texts.en:
Yorma is a repeat lender in the Mifex and Kiva program. She has done great with her first loan. She was able to invest in new products that were extremely popular during the end of the year because of the Christmas season. With the profits she made from those months, she was able to put tile on her floor, which was made out of cement before, and she was also able to buy some more mirrors. Yorma's business is now at a new level. Clients visit her more often because of the cleanliness of the shop and wholesalers supply her more because of the quantity of beauty products she sells.

She is very happy with the results of her investments and she is eager to continue growing. In fact, Yorma paid off her first loan ahead of schedule because of her success and her desire to receive further financing. She now wants to buy a high chair that will allow to her cut children's hair. She is hoping she will be able to break into this market as she sees that there are very few shops that focus on kids haircuts. She will also continue investing in hair and beauty products for her clients.

Her four children have benefited from the loan as they have had extra money to spend on clothes and materials for the new school year. Her husband does not help her anymore, as he is now working with Mifex as one of our new loan officers. Yorma feels extremely grateful that she has been able to grow along with our Credit Union and she is sends her appreciation to the lenders worldwide who have supported Ecuadorian entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Buy a new high chair and continue investing in inventory for her shop

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 41 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her husband works as a mechanic in an automotive repair shop. She breeds animals like pigs, rabbits, and chickens, which she subsequently sells to people in her community. She is part of the group "Metze 1". With the loan, she wants to buy more animals, food, and medicines to prevent illnesses between the animals.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

FILOMENA, TIENE 41 AÑOS , CASADA , 4 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO MECANICO EN UN TALLER AUTOMOTRIZ, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE ANIMALES COMO : PUERCOS , CONEJOS Y POLLOS LOS QUE DESPUES VENDE ENTRE LA GENTE DE SU COMUNIDAD. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO LLAMADO MEZTE 1. QUIERE CON SU PRESTAMO COMPRAR UNA MAYOR CANTIDAD DE ANIMALES ,ALIMENTOS Y MEDICAMENTOS PARA EVITAR ENFERMEDADES ENTRE ELLOS .

loans.use: breeding and selling of animals.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine E. is 32 years and is married with 4 children. She runs a shop in Siluko Road, Benin City, selling provisions.

Josephine has been in this business for the past 3 years and has been a member of LAPO for 4 years. She is in need of a loan of US$ 175 to allow her to purchase more provisions for resale in her little store.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for resale

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Sixty-one year-old Eugenio C. has been married to his wife, Francisca, 53, for many years. Together they have 3 grown-up children. One of their children is already married with a family of his own, while the other two live with Eugenio and Francisca.

Eugenio has been working as a tailor for more than 20 years. It is his life’s work, and he has been dedicated to doing the best work he can. His wife, Francisca, also contributes to the family earnings through the herbal medicines that she makes and sells.

At this time, Eugenio works solely for the National Police of Paraguay. He is responsible for providing the uniforms for the police in his region. As a result of this contract, Eugenio’s business is both very constant and quite busy.

For this opportunity, Eugenio has asked for a loan that will allow him to buy more material in order to cover the many orders they receive.

loans.use: To purchase material to make uniforms

loans.name: Del Tul Group

texts.es:
Among the many qualities of the clients of ComUnidad del Tul (term that Friendship Bridge uses to describe a Communal Bank), there is one that is worth emphasizing – the harmony that exists between the two different ethnic groups: Mayas Kachikeles and ladinas (descendents of Europe), that constitute the group. It is remarkable to see women that belong to different cultures work, organize themselves and get along so well. This characteristic particularly stands out when the Board of Directors, which consists of ladina and Maya Kachikel women, work together in a harmonious and effective manner.

The great majority of these women were weavers before receiving their first loan through Friendship Bridge. Many of them helped their mothers embroider huipiles (traditional Guatemalan dresses). However, with the loan they will receive from Kiva, our clients have chosen to change their path toward a more prosperous one.

At this time, the women of del Tul are investing their money in a variety of economic activities. For example, CarmeL. S. has been investing her loan in a toy store, MicaeL. J. in her convenience store, Rosa Ajpuac in her bakery, and Blanca U. in her candle and decorations store. Irma C. will invest in buying 300 roosters and hens, which she buys at 40 quetzales and then resells for 60 quetzales. Finally, another interesting initiative is that of Ana Sologui, who invests her money in her small parceL. (land plot) for harvesting coffee, which is then exported to Mexico and El Salvador.

The dreams of many of these women are centered on enabling themselves to buy a small plot of land where they can build a house or expand their respective homes, being that a small house is not adequate for their sizeable families. Delmy D. León said: “I would like to buy a plot because my house is not large enough for my family.” Delmy has eight children. Suseth G. would like to buy two cuerdas (1 cuerda = 25m x 25m) of coffee for her son. Finally, CarmeL. told her group that she would love to buy a car to be able to work in a more efficient and less sacrificed manner and to travel. These women have a lot of hope in life and in God, being that they have been given an opportunity to succeed. It is for this reason, that they should be supported so that they may continue having that hope.

This picture was taken during a pre-qualifying credit reunion.

One of the members of this group could not attend the reunion for medical reasons. She had to go to the Sololá hospital.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Dentro D. las muchas cualidades que tienen las clientas D. L. ComUnidad del Tul (término que utiliza Friendship Bridge para describir a un Banco Comunal) hay una que cabe destacar, L. armonía que se vive entre las dos distintas etnias: Mayas Kachikeles y ladinas (descendientes D. Europeos) que constituyen el grupo. Es remarcable ver a señoras que pertenecen a distintas culturas trabajar, organizarse y llevarse tan bien. Está característica sale a relucir sobre todo cuando L. Junta Directiva, compuesta por señoras ladinas y Mayas Kachikeles, trabajan juntas D. una manera armoniosa y eficiente.

L. gran mayoría D. señoras fueron tejedoras antes D. recibir su primer préstamo en Friendship Bridge. Muchas D. ellas ayudaban a sus madres a bordar huipiles (traje tradicional Guatemalteco). Sin embargo, con el préstamo que van a recibir D. Kiva, nuestras clientas han escogido cambiar D. rumbo hacia uno más prospero.

En estos momentos, las mujeres del Tul están invirtiendo su dinero en una variedad D. actividades económicas. Por ejemplo, CarmeL. S. ha estado invirtiendo su préstamo en una tienda D. juguetes, MicaeL. J. en su tienda D. consumo diario, Rosa Ajpuac en su panadería, Blanca U. en su tienda D. velas y adornos. Irma C., va a invertir su dinero para comprar 300 gallos y gallinas los cuales los compra a cuarenta quetzales y luego los revenD. a 60 quetzales. Finalmente, otra iniciativa interesante es L. D. Ana Sologui quien invierte su dinero en su pequeña parceL. D. café, el cual es exportado a México y a El Salvador.

Los sueños D. muchas D. estas señoras están concentrados en L. idea D. poder comprar un terrenito para poder construir su casita o para poder ampliar su respectiva casita ya que una pequeña casa no le alcanza para sus cuantiosas familias. Delmy D. León dijo: me gustaría comprar un terrenito porque L. casa ya no alcanza para mi familia.” Delmy D. León tiene ocho hijos. Suseth G. le gustaría comprar dos cuerdas (1 cuerda = 25m por 25m) D. café para su hijo. Finalmente, Carmelo contó al grupo que a elL. le encantaría comprar un carro para poder trabajar D. una manera más eficiente y menos sacrificada y para viajar. Estas señoras tienen mucha esperanza en L. vida y en Dios, ya que se les ha dado una oportunidad para seguir adelante. Es por eso que se les debería D. apoyar para que sigan teniendo esta esperanza.

L. foto fue tomada durante una reunión D. pre-crédito

Una D. las integrantes del grupo no pudo asistir a L. reunión por razones médicas, tuvo que ir al hospital D. Sololá

loans.use: Purchase capital to supply a toy store, a convenience store, a bakery, a candle and decorations store, a chicken reselling business, a coffee-growing parcela and other businesses in an effort to provide their families with more adequate housing and transportation.

loans.name: Qalsoom's Group

texts.en:
“I have been living in Riawind, Pakistan for the past two decades. I have five children and all of them work except one who is mentally challenged. I look after the house. One of my sons operates a breakfast food stand and we need a loan to purchase stock for it. We have taken loans for this business before and we are able to put food on the table.

I am a group leader as we know each other and are nieghbours and can guarantee repayments. One of them is Nusrat wants to have her husband’s wagon fixed. Shehnaz wants to purchase a buffalo and Gulnaz makes boxes for fruits and vegetables. Suriaya wants to invest in the shoe business and she makes shoe straps.”

loans.use: Buy stock for the food stall

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vu Thi L., 52 years old, is a member of the 14th branch of the Fund. She is living mainly as a fishmonger. This activity is very common in the coastal area. Usually, her husband and son will go fishing offshore, and she and her daughter will stay at home to sell the fish. Her children are all grown-up and become main workers of the house. Her income from fishing and fish mongering is pretty decent. However, her business will run better if she has better tools. She talked to her family and decided to borrow 400 USD to buy more fishing tools so that her fishing business will be more effective. Her current income is 250-270 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Liễn, 52 tuổi, thành viên chi nhánh 14 sinh sống chủ yếu bằng nghề buôn bán cá. Đây là nghề phổ biến với người dân vùng biển. Thông thường, chồng và con trai trong nhà sẽ ra biển đánh cá, vợ và con gái sơ chế và bán cá. Các con chị Liễn đều đã lớn và trở thành những lao động thực sự trong gia đình. Thu nhập từ việc đánh bắt cũng khá cao, nhưng cũng cần có đồ nghề tốt thì công việc mới tiến triển thuận lợi. Chị bàn bạc với gia đình và xin vay 400USD sắm thêm đồ nghề để việc đánh bắt mang lại hiệu quả cao nhất. Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình chị Liễn là 250-270USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy fishing-net, catching tools

loans.name: Kemuning Sari Group

texts.id:
Kemuning Sari is a hog farming group situated in the highland of Manistutu village, West Bali. Most of the people are farmers whose incomes are declining due to cocoa plantation failing to yield properly and due to the rice paddy fields not generating enough earning because of the raising fertilizer's cost. Some of the community members, who are mostly housewives, decide to help their husband generating more income for the family. They form a group named Kemuning Sari. The members agree to give the name of Kemuning Sari to represent the name of their hamlet of Kemuning and to reflect the Balinese belief of 'Sari' which means 'blessing'. They hope that the animals would grow very well as blessed and bring prosperity. Since they have a strong desire and very little capital, they requested for a loan from Dinari Foundation. Dinari then provides training and guidance on how to raise hogs, how to handle and prevent diseases, how to provide good animal feed, and how to manage the financial aspect of hog farming. After they felt comfortable, the group's officers are formed. Ni Putu Miyarni is the chair person, Ni Ketut Budiani is the treasurer, Ni Wayan Suriani is the secretary and there are ten other members. The loan will be used to purchase high quality piglets and animal feed. They hope that the earning will grow rapidly so they can improve the economic condition of their families.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Kemuning Sari sebuah kelompok ternak babi yang berlokasi didataran tinggi desa Manistutu, Bali Barat. Sebagian besar masyarakatnya bekerja sebagai petani yang penghasilannya sekarang sedang menurun karena tanaman coklat tidak berbuah dengan baik dan juga sawah yang dimiliki tidak menghasilkan dengan maksimal karena harga pupuk naik dengan drastis. Sehingga anggota kelompok yang sebagian besar ibu-ibu mempunyai keinginan untuk membantu penghasilan suaminya. Maka mereka membentuk sebuah kelompok. Nama ini diberikan karena sesuai dengan persetujuan anggota,bahwa tempat kelompok berada di dusun Kemuning sedangkan Sari sesuai dengan keyakinan orang Bali bahwa Sari itu berarti berkat. Sehingga nantinya semua ternak yang dipelihara oleh anggota supaya di berkati dan berkembang dengan baik. Karena keinginan yang begitu besar dari anggota untuk menjalankan usaha dibidang beternak babi ,sedangkan modal yang dimiliki sedikit hanya cukup untuk memelihara babi lokal,maka mereka mengajukan permohonan untuk pembinaan dan pinjaman modal ke Yayasan Dinari. Oleh Dinari kemudian diberikan pembinaan bagaimana beternak yang bagus, cara mengatasi penyakit secara tepat dan cepat, pemberian pakan yang baik,dan juga pengaturan keuangan agar modal untuk memelihara babi tidak dipakai untuk keperluan yang lainnya. Setelah semua dirasa cukup maka dibentuklah sebuah kepengurusan kelompok dimana yang menjabat sebagai ketua adalah Ni Putu Miyarni,Bendahara : Ni Ketut Budiani,Sektretaris : Ni Wayan Suriani dan anggota berjumlah 10 orang, kemudian Yayasan Dinari memberikan pinjaman modal. Modal ini oleh anggota ada yang dipakai untuk membeli bibit unggul dan ada juga yang dipakai untuk membeli pakan ternak yang berkwalitas. Dengan harapan keuntungan yang diperoleh menjadi bertambah dari pada memelihara babi lokal, sehingga ekonomi keluarga merekapun bisa menjadi lebih baik dari pada sekarang ini. Mereka sangat berterimakasih kepada Yayasan Dinari atas pinjaman modal ini,sehingga anggota Kemuning Sari dapat mengembangkan usahanya dibidang beternak babi.

loans.use: To purchase high quality piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Amina's Faraja Group

texts.en:
Amina is 27 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 6 and 4 years old. Amina owns a small food store that she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanaid , who sells coconuts.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Wanu

texts.en:
Wanu is 39 years old and is married with 6 children, ages 7-18 years old. Wanu is a charcoal and firewood seller. She started her business in 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

In the past, Wanu has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Awa D. is a married woman aged 42, with seven children (five boys and two girls). She lives in a rental property in the Medine neighborhood of SIkasso. Like many women of her age, Mrs. D. did not go to a modern school for family/financial reasons. In order to get by, she had to embark on activities that would generate an income (fabric dyeing and the restaurant business). She has been working with the microfinance institution Soro Yirwaso for five years. All previous loans have been successfully repaid. She wants to buy four bolts of cotton damask and 40 cases of drinks. She gets her fabric supplies from the market in Sikasso. She dyes the damask and sells it to her clientele made up mainly of customers from Sikasso and Syama. Mrs. D.’s cotton damask production is highly valued at the Sikasso market. In addition to selling cotton damask, Mrs. D. runs a restaurant in Syama. She expects to make an average monthly profit of CFA 275,000. With this profit she will be able to meet her family expenses. Right now she has bought some land used for housing and is in the process of construction. She expects to increase her revenue through the current loan.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Awa D. est une femme mariée de quarante deux (42) ans, mère de sept (7) enfants dont cinq (5) garçons et deux filles. Elle vit en location dans le quartier Medine de Sikasso. Comme beaucoup de femmes de son age, Madame D. n’a pas fréquenté l’école moderne et cela pour des raisons sociales. Pour s’en sortir elle était obligée de mener des activités génératrices de revenus (Teinture et Restauration). Elle est en relation avec l’Institution de Micro finance SORO YIRWASO il y a de cela cinq (5) ans. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elle achète 4 balles de tissus de basins et 40 casiers de boissons. Elle s’approvisionne en tissus sur le marché de Sikasso. Elle teint les basins et les vend a sa clientèle composee de clients de Sikasso et de Syama. La production de basin de Madame Awa D. est très prisée sur le marché de Sikasso. En plus de la vente de tissus basins Madame Awa D. exploite un restaurant à Syama . Elle compte réaliser en moyenne un bénéfice mensuel de 275.000 FCFA. avec ce bénéfice elle assurera ses dépenses familiales. Actuellement , elle a acheté un terrain à usage d’habitation q’elle est entrain de construire. Elle compte augmenter son chiffre d'affaires avec le pret en cours.

loans.use: To buy fabric and restaurant supplies

loans.name: Saom

texts.en:
Saom S., 56, lives with her husband, Chiv Trok, and their two daughters in the Prey Veng province. She is a wedding chef, who typically makes $3 (US dollars) per day. Her husband works in construction and makes $2 (US dollars) per day.

The family is also supported by their two daughters who are employed in a local garment factory.

Saom S. lives in an area that is very rural and her home is surrounded by farmers. Many of the poor farmers cannot afford to purchase a tractor, so they rent a tractor each season from someone who owns one.

Saom S. would like to purchase a small tractor to rent out to the local farmers to increase her family’s daily income.

Saom S. is asking for a loan of $1000 (US dollars) to make this purchase. She believes the profits from this purchase will allow her to improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: Purchase a small tractor

loans.name: Mubinakhon

texts.en:
S. Mubinakhon is 54 years old. She is widow and the head of the family with four children who have been the source of her strength to succeed in her business. After the death of her husband, Mubinakhon had to find ways to provide for herself and her four kids. For fifteen years she has had a small business selling the dried apricots. As a rule, she purchases apricots in the market and dries them by herself. Dried fruits, especially dried apricots, are very popular in Tajikistan. Besides, it is very good for the health.

Considering the constant demand for this kind of goods, the business of Mubinakhon is quite successful and brings stable income for the family. At the same time, Mubinakhon raises the cattle with the help of her sons. One of her dreams is that her children progress by means of their studies, for which with great sacrifice she sends them to a university that they can better their quality of life. 

Today Mubinakhon requests 2000 Somoni ($600) for the term of 6 months. She is going to spend the loan for purchasing the apricots with the purpose of drying them in order increase the range of goods for selling. Also, part of the loan she will spend for purchasing small cattle. 

Mubinakhon expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her. Let’s support this woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live.

loans.use: Purchasing of the apricots in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Amelio

texts.es:
El señor Amelio se casó con la señora Marciana, tienen 4 hijos quienes tienen ingresos propios y viven en forma independiente.

Amelio se dedica en la panadería. El también tiene ingresos por servicio de taxi, pues le paga a un chofer para realizar dicha actividad por que el ya no tiene esos reflejos para seguir conduciendo, razón por el cual montó la panadería.

El señor Amelio necesita seguir trabajando por que a sus 66 años sigue teniendo ese espíritu emprendedor y no quiere depender de sus hijos económicamente ya que el no cuenta con ingresos de jubilación porque siempre trabajo por cuenta propia. El Crédito solicitado es para compra de bolsas de harinas para vender a los negocios de su barrio.
texts.en:
Amelio is married to Marciana. They have 4 children who earn their own living and live independently.

Amelio runs a bakery. He also has income from his taxi service. He pays someone else to drive his taxi because he no longer has the reflexes that he needs to continue driving. This is why he started his bakery.

Amelio needs to continue to work because at 66 years old he is still an enterprising man and because he does not want to depend on his children financially. He does not have a retirement account because he has also been self-employed. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase sacks of flour to sell to businesses in his neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 20 sacks of flour

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika es originaria D. Cd. Solidaridad, Nuevo León, actualmente se dedica a la venta D. cométicos por catálogo. <

> Con la finalidad D. surtirse D. mercancías para atender las necesidades D. sus clientes solicita un préstamo por USD$300 a un plazo D. tres meses. <

> El inicio D. Erika en las ventas D. cosméticos por catálogo surgió como una inquietud transmitida por una D. sus amigas, al ella observar que este tipo D. productos generaban buenos resultados se animó a realizar ventas por si sola. Otros D. los factores que impulsaron a Erika en este tipo D. negocios fue el ser independiente y ayudar a su esposo en los gastos D. la familia. Erika cuenta con dos hijas pequeñas. <

> ¡Los invito a que apoyemos a Erika para que pueda lograr apoyando a su esposo y cumplir con las necesidades D. su hogar! <

>
texts.en:
Erika is originally from Ciudad Solidaridad, Nuevo León, and today she sells cosmetics by catalogue. With the goal of stocking a variety of merchandise to meet the needs of her customers she is asking for a USD$300 loan for a period of three months. Erika began selling cosmetics by catalog when her friends expressed dissatisfaction, and upon noting that this type of product generated good income she decided to go into sales herself. Other factors that pushed Erika to this type of business was to be independents and help her husband with the household expenses. Erika has two small daughters. I invite you – let’s support Erika so that she will be able to support her husband and meet her household’s needs!

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock merchandise samples of cosmetics sold by catalog

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sin M. is a villager in Tany village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a duck breeder. Since her duck flock is getting bigger and bigger, she does not have enough money to buy food so she is requesting a loan to purchase more food to feed her ducks. Her husband, Mr. En Om, owns a hectar to cultivate rice to earn a living.

Mrs. Sin M. is 39 years old and the mother of six children one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a farmer. Three others are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is three years old so that child is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more food to feed her ducks

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin es separado, tiene 57 años y vive solo. Desde hace mas de 8 años fabrica todo tipo de artículos en cuerina y cuero, elabora carteras, monederos, billeteras, entre otros artículos, con una máquina de coser cuero, la cual es un instrumento indispensable para su trabajo. Esta es su ocupación diaria y sus lugares de venta son principalmente los mercados de las ciudades de Huancayo y Huancavelica, cubre pedidos de sus clientes que solicitan de acuerdo a las temporadas los artículos que más demanda tienen. Para Edwin, un reto a superar es la creciente  competencia, sabe que tiene que innovar con nuevos diseños, por ejemplo en las carteras. Este es su primer ciclo con MFP, sin embargo él ya tiene un historial crediticio  con buenas referencias. Don Edwin solicita este préstamo que le servirá para aumentar su  capital de trabajo, comprar más cuero al por mayor, ya que éste es su insumo básico.
texts.en:
Edwin is 57-year-old man who is separated and lives alone. For over 8 years, he has been making all types of leather and faux leather goods—such as wallets, coin purses, and handbags, among other items—with a sewing machine for leather, which is an indispensable work tool. This is his occupation, and he sells his products mainly in the markets of Huancayo and Huancavelica. He fills his customers’ orders depending the highest demands of the season. For Edwin, a challenge that he needs to overcome is ever-increasing competition. He knows that he must innovate with new designs for the handbags. This is his first cycle with MFP; however, he already has a credit history with good references. Mr. Edwin S. is requesting this loan in order to increase his work capital—he wants to purchase more wholesale leather because he uses this material the most.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more leather to make leather goods

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses M. is a micro-entrepreneur. He runs a shop at Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam city. He sells varieties of items including cereal commodities. He purchases the items from Kariakoo city market and other wholesale shops around. Income derived from the business is used to feed his family and pay school fees. He is in need of a loan of T.shs 800,000 to meet the business demand.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Ngov

texts.en: Ngov S. is 58 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province where she has owns a plot of land in her village. She is a mother of one child and is married to Moth Set who is a local brick layer and earns about $1.50 per day to help meet with his family's expenses. She is widely known in her business of growing rice crops and vegetables, which she plants twice a year. She earns an income of approximately $2 each day. Ngov works hard at her business activities every day and never wastes time. Growing is S.'s main source of income to help sustain her family and especially make sure her receives enough food. S. has requested a loan to help purchase equipment to repair her old house. The loan will make her family's living conditions more comfortable.

loans.use: to repair her old house

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. sells building materials at Nyankumasi near Cape Coast. Elizabeth has received junior high education. She is married and has 5 dependents. Her husband is a farmer.

Elizabeth has been selling building materials since 1990. She is responsible for helping her husband pay rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of building materials to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of her sales of building materials.

loans.use: additional capital to  increase the sale of building materials

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina K., who opened her cosmetics shop a year ago to improve her family’s standard of living, sells a variety of goods including cream, make-up materials, and glass bangles. She spends her income to help her husband, Raghu Raj Kayastha, a government worker, meet the family’s expenses, and is now requesting her first loan of Rs 10000.00 to buy additional cosmetic goods for her shop.

The mother of two children, a son and daughter, Mina lives in a single family home with her husband and two children. Her daughter is taking the BSC (Nursing) course and her son is studying in grade 12. Both also help her in her shop.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Afif

texts.en: Afif R. is a 51-year-old floor tile specialist from Maarakeh in southern Lebanon. He is married with 3 children. He has been serving his village and the surrounding villages with tiles for the past 24 years. Afif is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy a small van to help him further manage his time.

loans.use: Buy a small van

loans.name: Ane

texts.en:
Ane C. N., 40, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in the flower garden business. She sells her flowers to the villagers/general public 7 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

She has had 3 previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Ane’s only access to capital because she can't qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and farming tools

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
El señor Tomas S. tiene 57 años y esta casado con la señora Ramona Agüero de 38 años. La misma se encuentra actualmente trabajando en la Argentina.  Tienen tres hijos, dos varones de 11 y 9 años respectivamente y una nena de 7 años, que se encuentran cursando sus estudios primarios.

El señor Tomas posee un taller de carpintería en su domicilio desde hace 34 años y en el mismo fabrica puertas, ventanas, placares, cómodas  y diferentes tipos de muebles para varias mueblerias.

Desea invertir el préstamo en la compra mayorista de distintos tipos de maderas e insumos para la fabricación de muebles.  De esa manera abarataría sus costos y obtendría mayor margen de ganancias por la venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
Tomas S. is 57 years old and married to Ramona Agüero who is 38. She finds herself currently working in Argentina. They have 3 children, two sons ages 11 and 9 respectively, and one daughter who is 7 years old; they are in primary school. Tomas has had a carpentry shop in his home for the past 34 years, where he makes doors, windows, cabinets, bureaus, and different types of items for various furniture stores. He wants to invest the loan into the wholesale purchase of different types of woods and furniture-making supplies. In this way, he would be able to lower his costs and obtain a greater profit margin from the sale of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Agée d’une cinquantaine d’années, Mme A. Akou est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants avec deux (02) autres personnes de sa cousine en charge. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de farine de manioc "Gari". Très appréciée dans la ration alimentaire, elle nécessite beaucoup de travail et d’efforts. Ainsi, afin de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus élevée de sa clientèle, Mme A. sollicite un financement pour acheter un vaste champ de manioc afin d’avoir une réserve importante de matière première. Le bénéfice tiré de cette activité sera mis à la disposition des familles démunies pour leur survie.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Akou is 50-something, married, and the mother of four children, plus she has two others of her cousin's to support. Her main work involves selling cassava flour, gari, which is highly valued among food provisions. It requires a lot of work and effort. So, in order to satisfy the burgeoning demand of her customers, she's requesting financing to buy a vast field of cassava, so as to have a major reserve of raw materials. The profits derived from this business will be made available to destitute families, so they may survive.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell cassava flour

loans.name: Femmes Commerçantes N° 14 Group

texts.fr: coumba,fatou ,diarètou,awa et thillo sont un groupe de cinq femmes dynamiques qui mènent des activités génératrices de revenu au marché grand thies;elles vendent des produits diversifiés dont les légumes,le poisson,la salade et les fruits de mer et maitrisent bien leur domaine d'activité;elles ont ouvert un compte à la mutuelle et veulent contracter un pret pour augmenter leur fonds de roulement
texts.en:
Coumba, Fatou, Diarètou, Awa, et Thillo make up a group of 5 energetic women who have businesses in the Grand Thies market. They sell various products, among others vegetables, fish, lettuce, and seafood, and they are very good at managing their businesses. They have joined our institution and would like to take out a loan to use to bolster their working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of various products

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida D. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 52 years old, married, and has five adult children. Nida owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She also has a piece of land were she raises bananas. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Nida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. Nida is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business and also used for her small farm. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business and for farming

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Philomina L. is 44 years old, married and has 3 children. She sells plastic in a retail shop. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 140,000 to purchase more plastic to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell.

loans.name: Wisdom

texts.en: Wisdom Z. sells fish at sea-view in Elmina. Wisdom has received a junior high school education.  She is single and has no children. Wisdom has been selling fish since 2004. She is responsible for paying utility bills. She loan will be used to buy more fish for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Be Together Group

texts.en: Currently, Korto sells her items off a table located in the town of Kpayea in the Zorzor District. She is illiterate and a single parent with four children, of whom none is in school. She is currently engaged in the sale of dry goods and hopes to purchase a larger table. She dreams of supporting all of her children in school and providing good medical care.

loans.use: To purchase a larger table so that she can sell oil, pepper, onions, and other dry goods.

loans.name: Gladys Paula

texts.es:
La señora GLADYS PAULA S. M., tiene 36 años, vive en el distrito de Moche , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal LOS JAZMINES
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene  3 hijos quienes  depende económicamente de ella, porque aun se encuentran en el colegio.
GLADYS se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, gaseosas, jabones, verduras, carnes, etc. en la tienda de comestibles que tiene instalada en su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invertió en la compra de mas insumos alimenticios para abastecer su tienda. 
Este crédito de 800 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar mas insumos como arroz, fideos, azúcar, vitrinas y productos de belleza.
GLADYS, sueña con ampliar su negocio y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. GLADYS PAULA S. M. is 36 years old and lives in the Moche district of Trujillo province, in the La Libertad region of Peru. She belongs to the communal bank LOS JAZMINES. This businesswoman has completed the fifth year of her secondary studies. She has 3 children who are economically dependent upon her as they are still in school.

Gladys sells food and groceries such as: rice, sugar, noodles, soft drinks, soap, vegetables, meats, etc. in the grocery store that she operates out of her home. Her first loan of 300 nuevos soles was invested in the purchase of additional food supplies to stock her store. This loan of 800 nuevos soles will be used to purchase more supplies such as rice, noodles, sugar, glass display cases and beauty products.

Gladys dreams of increasing her business in order to obtain higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food ingredients, display cases and beauty products

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is thirty years old. He is divorced and has given birth to one child, a boy in school. He lives with his son in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town.

William is a refrigerator repairer. He repairs broken refrigerators for clients in his community. William has been in business for three years and has a number of apprentices in training.

William reports that sometimes the refrigerators he repairs need replacement parts. He wants to take the opportunity to provide and sell some of these spare parts to his clients. William is requesting a loan to buy refrigerator spare parts for resale.

loans.use: To buy refrigerator spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia Cañon, a 48-year old single parent, has been working hard on her hog raising business. She lives with her two sons; the eldest is already working and the other one is enrolled in college. Both help her with home chores when there’s no work and classes.

Alicia is raising pigs to get income to support her and the children, especially their education. She has been both mother and father to them since she and her husband parted ways years ago for domestic reasons she opted to keep to herself. Life was hard for her then, but she was able to cope and move on thanks to her faith in the Almighty. She found consolation in getting into business. She also sells fresh pork meat. She brings her pigs to the butcher when they are ready for slaughtering. Alicia also cooks meals and sells them to customers. She earns more than 45,000 PHP a month from these business activities.

She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005. She applied for a new loan with the cooperative in the amount of 20,000 PHP to have available funds for the renovation of her pig pen. She would like to extend her pen because her pigs are now crammed inside it. She only used to have six pigs. Now, she already has nine mother pigs and many growing baby pigs.

Alicia hopes to acquire a farm lot where she can build a bigger pig farm complex. She also wishes to build an apartment. She dreams to see her sons living happily with their own families. She is very thankful to the Almighty for giving her two loving sons. She considers them as gift from heaven.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Renovation/expansion of pig pens

loans.name: Roukayatou Adédjokè

texts.fr: O. Roukayatou Adédjokè est née le 24/09/1974 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Roukayatou Adédjokè est mariée à EFIYEMI Camille, un soudeur. Roukayatou Adédjokè et Camille ont deux enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Pk10 dans la Commune de Sèmè-Podji. Roukayatou Adédjokè vend les produits divers (pâte dentifrice, brosse à dent, savon, lampe torche, etc.). Roukayatou Adédjokè vend ses produits dans son quartier à Pk10 et s'approvisionne en ces différents produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Roukayatou Adédjokè a eu deux crédits de ALIDé et elle a bien remboursé ces crédits. Pour augmenter le volume de son activité à la grande satisfaction de sa clientèle Roukayatou Adédjokè sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Roukayatou Adédjokè O. was born on 24 September 1974 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Roukayatou Adédjokè is married to Camille Efiyemi, a welder. Roukayatou Adédjokè and Camille have two children in the care, both of whom are in school. The family lives in the Pk!0 area in the village of Sèmè-Podji. Roukayatou Adédjokè sells a variety of products (toothpaste, toothbrushes, soap, flashlights, etc.). Roukayatou Adédjokè sells her products in her area of Pk10 and supplies herself at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Roukayatou Adédjokè has already obtained two loans through ALIDE (one of Kiva's field partners) and repaid these loans properly. In order to increase the volume of her business and satisfy her clientele, Roukayatou Adédjokè is seeking a third loan through ALIDE.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products for resale: toothpaste, toothbrushes, soap, flashlights, etc.

loans.name: Little Stars Group

texts.es: Es un grupo muy responsables en sus pagos, viven  en una zona muy alejada de la ciudad, se conocen bien, no cuentan con servicios basicos como ser alcantarillado, agua potable, etc. Su grupo se llama "ESTRELLITAS", donde, el Banco de Emprendimiento esta en su 3º Ciclo, la  mesa directiva esta conformada la siguiente manera,  como presidenta esta  la señora Margarita ,ella es muy responsable y lider de su grupo, tiene 2 hijos es casada ella elabora masitas y su esposo es chofer. Como tesorera esta la socia Ruth  quien es muy responsable y conocedora del manejo del efectivo tiene 2 hijos es casada, es confeccionista de ropa el credito lo utiliza para  aumento de capital. Como secretario esta el socio Ronal es soltero no tiene hijos,trabaja importando novedades de la frontera con el Peru, el credito lo utiliza para capital.
texts.en:
The Little Stars Group is a Communal Bank that is starting its third loan cycle. The members are very responsible with their payments. They live in an area that is far from the city and know each other well. They do not have many needs other than the basic necessities such as sewage services, clean drinking water, etc.

The group leaders are as follows:

Sra. Margarita is the group president and a very responsible leader. She is married and has two children. She makes pastries, while her husband works as a chauffeur.

Sra. Ruth is the group treasurer and is very responsible and knowledgeable in handling cash. She is married and has two children. She is a seamstress and will use her loan to increase her business capital.

Sr. Ronal is the group secretary. He is single and has no children. He imports novelty products from Peru. His loan will be used as business capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Leonza Maria

texts.es: Leonza Maria es casada, tiene 2 niños: 1 de 9 años estudiando la primaria y una bebita de 6 meses de edad, trabaja en el sistema penitenciario de Juigalpa como sub-alguacil reeducadora desde hace 6 años, esta solicitando su 7mo refinanciamiento para mejora de vivienda, actualmente habita en casa de sus suegros, y desea darle condiciones al lugarcito que tiene, pues no tiene piso y quiere poner la ceramica en la salita y construir un cuarto para asi brindar mejores condiciones a sus hijos y mas a la pequeñita que esta inquieta por aprender a dar sus primeros pasitos.  Leonza es muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo y vecino, y tiene el sueño de que sus hijos estudien y puedar ser personas de bien.
texts.en:
Leonza Maria is married with 2 children, a 9-year-old in elementary school and a 6-month-old baby girl. She has been working for 6 years in the penitentiary system of Juigalpa as a re-educating sub-sheriff. She is requesting her 7th loan to improve her house. Presently she is living with her in-laws and she wishes to improve the conditions of their small house as it has no floor. She wants to put ceramic in the living room and build a room to offer better conditions to her children especially to the little one who is anxious to start walking. Leonza is well-liked by her fellow workers and neighbors and it is her dream that her children study and become good individuals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room and place ceramic floor.

loans.name: Jacel

texts.en:
Jacel T. is from the village of San Manuel. She is 22 years old. Jacel is married. To make a living, Jacel sells electronics in the local community. Jacel has been engaged in her business for some years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Jacel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Jacel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a wider variety of items to sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 59 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida ha trabajado mucho por sobre salir en la vida, vive en su casa propia, y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.
Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para abrir su tienda de abarrotes, aproximadamente a las 6 de la mañana comienza con sus ventas diarias, ya que la gente que vive por su barrio sale a trabajar muy temprano. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y persuasiva, lo cual ha hecho que tenga mayor preferencia.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que así se puede enterar de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse tan temprano, ya que en las temporadas de frío se le hace muy difícil.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Luz con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre está pendiente de los acuerdos a los que lleguen en el grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Luz, age 59, is a woman who has worked hard throughout her life in order to succeed. She lives in her own home, and what he most desires is to have a relaxing old age. Each day, she gets up very early to open her grocery store. At approximately 6:00 a.m. she is open for business since the people in her neighborhood go out to work quite early. She is a very happy and persuasive shopkeeper, which has given her a nice advantage. What she likes the most about her job is visiting with her customers. That way she can learn about what is happening in the neighborhood. She has spent 11 years at this job, and having to get up so early is the part that she considers the most difficult. It is especially hard for her during the colder seasons. This is Luz's sixth loan with MFP. She has always been very punctual in her repayments, and she hopes to continue doing so now. She is a very responsible member of her community bank, and she is very attentive to the decisions reached in the group. With the 1,000 soles she is requesting, she plans to buy more products to better supply her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the selection of merchandise

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana S. is from the town of Rose Park Concepcion, Tarlac. She is 57 years old. Juliana is married and has 2 adult children. Juliana owns & operates a business running a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Juliana has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Juliana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Juliana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & to add to her working capital. Juliana is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Juliana from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Leidis Mariela

texts.es: La joven Leidis labora como administradora  de la alcaldia el coral desde hace un año, tiene un  bebe de 2 añitos de edad, a pesar que ella  vive con sus padres el padre del niño le pasa una pensiòn alimenticia para el niño, la abuelita del bebe cuida del niño cuando ella esta trabajando ya que son una familia bien unida. Con este credito pretende  hecharle el piso a  a la hibitaciòn ya que es de tierra para tener  mejor comodidad para ella y su hijo, su sueño es seguir estudiando para ser en el futro una excelente profesional y que su familia tenga mucha salud.
texts.en:
