Leidis has been working for one year as an administrative assistant for the city of El Coral. She has a two year old baby. Even though she lives with her parents, the child’s father provides financial support. The child’s grandmother takes care of him while Leidis is working since her family is very close.

With this loan, she will install a floor in her house since she already has the land on which she and her son can live comfortably. Her dreams are to continue her education so that she will have a bright professional future and for her family to have good health.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a floor in her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase lingerie in bulk.

loans.name: Luz Del Trancito

texts.es:
La señora Rodríguez es trabajadora activa de la escuela san Ignacio del o yola de la ciudad de somotillo.
Ella nos solicita el crédito para comprar pintura y pintar su casa de habitación y así mejorar sus condiciones de ella y de su familia.
Es madre de tres hijos los cuales están bajo su tutela ellos son menores de edad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rodríguez is an active worker in San Ignatius Loyola School in the city of Somotillo.

She needs this loan to buy paint and to paint her home and thereby improve her living conditions and those of her family.

She is a mother to 3 children, who are under her care and are underage.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paint to paint her home.

loans.name: Felicita Esperanza

texts.es:
Felicita P. de 34 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y solo cuenta con luz como servicios básicos. Su esposo es agricultor con el tiene una niña de 2 años. 

Felicita inicio  hace 2 años su negocio con la ayuda de su hermana vendiendo arroz y azúcar a las afuera de su casa. Aunque era de molestia el polvo de la calle ella continúo con su negocio.  

Ahora ella tiene una pequeña tienda. Trabaja todos los días desde las 06h30 hasta las 19h00, vende arroz, azúcar, aceites etc. Una de las complicaciones que tiene es ir a comprar los productos al mercado porque tiene que evitar que le roben. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar enlatados, embutidos y bebidas para su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener una papelería.
texts.en:
Felicita P., 34, lives in a periurban zone of Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is cement and the only basic service it has is electricity. Her husband is a farmer and they have a 2-year-old daughter. Felicita began selling rice and sugar outside her house two years ago with her sister's help. Although the dust from the street was a real nuisance, she continued with this work. Now, she has a small store. She is open for business every day from 6:30am until 7pm; she sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. One of her obstacles is having to go to the market to buy her supplies because she has to avoid being robbed. She will use the loan to buy canned goods, cured meats and beverages for her store. In the future she would like to have a stationery store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For canned goods, cured meats, beverages.

loans.name: Ruth Samary

texts.es: Ruth Samary de 28 años de edad, es soltera  labora como docente de la Escuela Alfonso Cortes de Nueva Guinea desde hace 8 años, tiene una bebe de 4 años y seis meses,esta solicitando su 4to crèdito  para comprar mareiales de construcciòn y lograr repellar y hecarle el piso a una habitaciòn, para asi tener mejor comodidad en el hogar, su compañero de vida labora como agricultor en la finca de sus padres y le ayuda con los gastos familiares, con el credito anterior logro construir una habitacion, este es el segundo credito que tramita para mejoras de vivienda y expresa que se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado por el fondo kiva, su sueño para el futuro es seguri mejorando poco a poco las condicones de vida de su familia y seguri estudiando para ser una mejor profesional.
texts.en:
Ruth Samary is 28 years old, single, and has a 4½ year old child. She has been working as a teacher at the Alfonso Cortes School in Nueva Guinea for eight years. Ruth is requesting her fourth loan so that she can buy construction materials to install a floor and whitewash a room so that her home will be more comfortable. Her partner works on her parents’ farm and helps with the family expenses.

Her previous loan was used to build a room. This is the second time she has used a loan to make improvements to her home. Ruth expresses that she is very grateful for the support provided by the Kiva funds. Her dreams for the future are to continue improving gradually her family’s living conditions and continue her studies so that she can become a better professional.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to install a floor and whitewash a room

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a hard working and honest man. He rides a motorcycle. He loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with his customers. He works for long hours to be able to support his home. He is married with four children and he is 50 years old. His wife also works to support their home. Amos is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase a motorcycle to boost his business. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is a 32-year-old single man.  He owns pool tables which he rents out to earn a living.  He realized that this business can be profitable since many people love playing pool in their leisure time. He has been in the business for three years.  

Raphael also sells water so as to be able to cover his personal expenses and also to support his family.   He was previously employed before he started his business.   He saves his money with his group in Faulu Kenya called 'Siahani' which guarantees loans for its members.   He hopes to expand his business and also he desires to own a vehicle for public transportation in the future. He has requested a loan of Kes 35,000 from Faulu Kenya to get another donkey for transporting water and also to buy another pool table.

loans.use: To add a pool table and buy another donkey

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch Y. was born in 1959 and is living in Dry Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Chhoun Sen, are fishermen who can earn some money to support their family's living. This couple has four children, two of whom are laborers, while the others are too young to work or study. Although they try to work hard, they earn little income; so, to improve the condition their family's living, Mrs. Touch Y. is asking for a loan to buy a new motorbike to transport vegetables to resell as a start to a new business. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Martha Johanna

texts.es: Martha Johanna tiene 37 años, su actividad es la venta de recargas telefónicas. Hace más de 4 años, que se dedica a este negocio. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo los cuales estudian por el esfuerzo que Martha realiza. Ella dio inicio por iniciativa propia pues ella tenía la necesidad  de proveerle a su familia el alimento diario, siempre está pensando en la forma como atraer a sus clientes. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para obtener mas recargas en cantidades mayores. Su deseo es mejorar y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha is 37 years old and has been selling phone cards for more than four years. She has two children who are able to attend school, thanks to Martha’s efforts. She started this business on her own initiative because she needed a way to provide for her family. She is always looking for better ways to serve her customers. She is asking for this loan in order to buy larger quantities of phone cards. Martha would like to improve and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: God Is Able #2 Group

texts.en:
Saybah Z. who is holding the sign is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'God Is Able #2'. She is 45 years old, married and has two children who are 20 and 22 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to poverty. Both of her children are attending school.

For 10 years, she has been selling used clothes at Redlight Market, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of used clothes. She describes herself as a caring mother.

Her dream is to grow her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 27 years old, married and has a 5 year old child. To make a living, Ramil owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ramil has been engaged in his business for over 10 years. Ramil joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramil has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ramil is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ramil from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but, additionally, savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Loma Bonita Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama LOMA BONITA, porque asi se le conoce al lugar donde radican desde hace mucho tiempo. Está ubicado en el Estado de México en México.  El grupo está conformado por  13 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a CrediComún. 

Carolina Cristina Castañeda García es la tesorera del grupo. Tiene 31, estudió hasta el 2° año de secundaria, es comerciante y tiene en total 2 hijos 1 mujer y 1 varón.  Ella se dedica a la venta de trastes y cosméticos que inició hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para surtir más mercancía de trastes y cosméticos. Sus clientes comentan que ella comenzó sus ventas ofreciéndolos de casa en casa para darse a conocer y que les gusta comprar con ella ya que es muy cumplida para la entrega de los productos y por la misma confianza que ya le tienen prefieren comprar con ella que  en otros lugares. El negocio lo inicio por que la motivo su suegra a vender, empezó por los cosméticos y de ahí vio la opción de vender los trastes ya que era algo que sus clientas le solicitaban.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente motivada y contenta por que sabe que va a poder superarse.   Quiere este crédito para poder iniciar la construcción de un local en su casa para que sus clientes tengan un lugar en donde poder comprarle sus productos y que así mismo su negocio crezca.   También espera que el crecimiento de sus ventas le permita seguirles dando estudio a sus hijos y apoyar en el crecimiento de su casa.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
YAZMIN H.L.                Venta de Calzado
TOMASA ARACELI A.G.        Venta de Ropa
ROCIO C.R.                 Venta de Frutas y Verduras
JULIA E.R.                 Venta de  Artículos para el Hogar
GRACIELA E.Z. 	           Venta de Calzado
DULCE MARIA G..B.          Venta de Calzado
TERESA G..C.               Venta de Comida
SOCORRO TRINIDAD G.C       Venta de Comida
SUSANA P.P.                Venta de Jarcería
ZITA V.F.                  Venta de Calzado
CONCEPCION Z. A.           Venta de Cosmético
JOSEFINA Z.G.              Venta de Papelería y Mercería
texts.en:
This group is named “Loma Bonita” (Pretty Hill) because that is how the place where they have lived for a long time is known. It is located in the state of Mexico in Mexico. The group is comprised of 13 members. This is the first time they have asked CrediComún for a loan. Carolina Cristina Castañeda García is the treasurer of the group. She is 31 years old, and she attended school until her second year of high school. She is a merchant. She has two children, a son and a daughter. She sells cooking utensils and cosmetics. She started two years ago. She is requesting a loan to stock more cooking utensils and cosmetics. Her customers say that she started her sales by selling door to door to get to know them and what they like to buy from her. She is very reliable about delivering the products. Because of the confidence they have in her they prefer to buy from her instead of other places. She started the business because her mother-in-law suggested that she sell. She started with cosmetics, and from there she saw the option of selling cooking utensils. She saw that her customers were asking her for cooking utensils. At the time of requesting this loan she feels motivated and happy because she knows that she will be able to do well. She wants this loan to be able to start the construction of a place in her house. This is for her customers to have a place where they can buy her products. It is also so that her business will grow. She hopes that the sales increase will allow her to keep providing an education to her children and will help with the expansion of her house. The other members of the group are: YAZMIN H.L. Sells footwear TOMASA ARACELI A.G. Sells clothes ROCIO C.R. Sells fruit and vegetables JULIA E.R. Sells items for the home GRACIELA E.Z. Sells footwear DULCE MARIA G..B. Sells footwear TERESA G..C. Sells food SOCORRO TRINIDAD G.C Sells food SUSANA P.P. Sells cleaning supplies ZITA V.F. Sells footwear CONCEPCION Z. A. Sells cosmetics JOSEFINA Z.G. Sells stationery and sewing supplies

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more cooking utensils and cosmetics

loans.name: Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es:
“ SIEMPRE ADELANTE “ es un grupo formado por 8 socias la presidenta del grupo  es Juana  quien  por mucho tiempo trabajo en Venezuela al  llegar al Perú decidió invertir sus ahorros en el rubro D. venta D. comidas ella  contaba con experiencia  en la preparación D. alimentos ahora tiene un puesto D. venta D. comida y productos D. la selva  su negocio se llama “ la rica palomita” allí venD. platos típicos como pescado a la plancha ,tacacho, juanés etc. Tiene trabajando en su negocio 10 años  con el fruto D. su trabajo ella logra mantener  a sus 04 hijos darles buena educación y buena calidad D. vida.
El dinero D. su préstamo lo usara para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio comprando mas productos entre pescados, carnes y otros ingredientes, también quiere ampliar su puesto D. venta y hacerlo mas granD..

* La Sra. Juana es la quinta D. la derecha (parada)esta con anteojos.
texts.en:
“Siempre Adelante” (Ahead Always) is a group composed of 8 members. The group's president is Juana who for a long time, worked in Venezuela. Upon returning to Peru, she decided to invest her savings in making and selling meals. She can count on long experience in food preparation and now has a post where she sells meals and products from the forest. Juana's business is called “The Rich Little Dove”. Here she sells typical dishes, including grilled fish and other local delicacies. Juana has done this for 10 years and her earnings support her 4 children, providing them with a good education and quality of life. The money from her loan will be invested in her business, purchasing foods, including fish, meat, and other ingredients. Also, she wants to expand her sales post, making it larger. In the above picture Juana is 5th from the right, wearing glasses.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FOOD PRODUCTS FOR PREPARING TYPICAL DISHES IN HER RESTAURANT

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with no children yet. She sells various types of women's clothing. Her kiosk is located at the food market. This location allows Irina to offer her goods to many people who come to the market to get food. Irina started her business five years ago. Her mother, who had a lot of sales experience, helped Irina to make this business a success.

Irina would like to borrow 15,000 Ukrainian grivna to increase her assortment of inventory. She would like to develop her business further and start a second location.

loans.use: To increase the assortment.

loans.name: Ramiro Antonio

texts.es: Ramiro Antonio de 28 años, tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general. Comenzó hace 2 años con su negocio, pues con el paso del tiempo es que ha ido creciendo, pues ha puesto mucho empeño en este medio de vida el sale a vender sus productos de manera ambulante, ya que así obtiene más clientes nuevos. Trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche  todos los días. Para poder seguir con su negocio quiere comprar una gran variedad de productos y así mejorar cada día su actividad. En el futuro quiere trasladar el negocio en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ramiro Antonio is 28 years old and his business is the sale of general merchandise. He started it 2 years ago, and with the passing of time it's grown. He has invested a lot of effort and determination into this way of earning a living. He sells his products as a mobile vendor; that's how he gets new customers. He works from 6 in the morning to 7 at night every day. To be able to continue with his business, he'd like to buy a wide variety of productos to improve his daily activity. In the future he'd like to operate the business out of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elijah Kimeli

texts.en:
Elijah Kimeli K. is a 39-year-old businessman who sells dairy products like milk and also sells cattle to his customers at a profit. He is married to Emily Jepkemei, who is 32 years old, and they have no children at the moment but have four relatives that live with them. Elijah runs his business in Kapseret, ten kilometers from Eldoret town, and has been in this business for about four years.

Elijah was introduced to KADET by one of its credit officers and he has no history with any other micro-finance institution. He is applying for his first loan of Kshs 50,000 with KADET which he plans to use to purchase more cattle to sell later at a profit.

Elijah hopes to operate a large cattle farm, whereby he will be able to supply the best quality milk for his customers.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle to sell later at a profit

loans.name: Mame Awa

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Mame Awa  P. est une femme divorcée de 42 ans sans enfants habitant  dans la localité de Yoff. Elle s’est lancée dans le commerce  par nécessité  car elle doit assurer ses besoins vitaux. Et aussi soutenir sa maman.  Elle s’active dans le commerce de marchandises de toutes sortes (chaussures, tissus). Elle est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis février 2009 .c’est sa première demande  de crédit .Elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000  prévu pour   l’achat  de tissus t de chaussures destinés  a la vente.. Le  prêt lui permettra de mieux valoriser ses gains pour faire face a ses besoins personnels ainsi que ceux de sa mère.
texts.en: Miss Mame Awa  P. is a divorced woman of 42 who has no children. She lives in Yoff. She got into business by necessity since she has to fend for herself and also, support her mother. She sells all sorts of goods (shoes, cloth). She has been a member of the Yoff branch since February 2009. This is her first request for a loan. She is asking for the amount of 100,000 francs to buy cloth and shoes destined for resale. The loan will allow her to make more profit so that she can support herself and her mother.

loans.use: to add to her working capital

loans.name: Isaura Isabel

texts.es: La señora Isaura Isabel inicio este negocio de venta de telas. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio. Pues ha sido muy difícil mantener a su familia. Ella es una persona muy responsable y busca la forma de salir adelante.   Comenzó con esta actividad porque no tenía un trabajo estable. Ella vive en lugar muy traficado pues hay diversos clientes que le solicitan una gran variedad de telas.   Ella indica que quiere comprar una casa para sus hijos y les pueda dejar algo.  El crédito lo destinara para compra de telas de diferentes colores y de muy buena calidad, está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Isaura Isabel started selling fabric over 8 years ago.  Supporting her family has been very difficult.  She is a very responsible person who always seeks ways to get ahead in life.  She started this business because she didn’t have a steady job.

The area where she lives has a lot of foot traffic and she has many of customers who ask for a variety of fabrics.  She says that she wants to buy a house for her children so that she will have something to leave them.

The loan will be used to buy good quality fabric in an assortment of colors.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: To buy fabric in assorted colors.

loans.name: Zonia Maribel

texts.es:
Zonia tiene 30 años D. edad, es comerciante D. Ropa Americana, vive en Jiquilisco departamento D. Usulután con su esposo y su hija D. 14 años D. edad; este negocio lo atienD. desD. hace un año, ella es discapacitada y sus labores las desarrolla en una silla D. ruedas.
El deseo D. superación D. Zonia es granD., y su espíritu D. crecer como microempresaria la lleva a solicitar un préstamo para la compra D. ropa para la venta, ella a pesar D. su problema físico, está en condiciones para seguir con su negocio y con este préstamo piensa contar con variedad D. ropa, para tener acceso a ventas mayores.
Su proyección con el préstamo es lograr la inversión deseada, que su plan D. mejorar el negocio se pueda desarrollar y ser un cliente excelente en esta institución.
texts.en:
Zonia is 30 years old and is a merchant of American clothing. She lives in Jiquilisco, department of Usulután, with her husband and 14-year-old daughter. She has been looking after this business for one year. She is disabled and carries out her work in a wheelchair. 

The desire to overcome in Zonia is strong and her push for growth as the owner of a micro-enterprise has inspired her to seek a loan in order to buy clothing for sale. In spite of her physical handicap she is in good shape to continue on with her business. With this loan she plans to stock a variety of apparel in order to access bigger sales volumes. 

Her projected goals with the loan are to achieve the desired investment, that her ideas for improving the business would go forward as planned and that she would be an excellent client in this institution.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en:
Gaudence  is 27 years old. She is married and has a one-year-old child. Her husband works as a Credit Manager at the Popular Bank. Gaudence owns a small shop where she sells a variety of consumable goods such as cooking oil, soap, sugar and maize flour. 

She has requested this loan to buy additional merchandise and the profit will be used to expand a second shop she plans to set up. Gaudence's dream is to see the profits from her business double in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, sugar, and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es: Martha Azucena es una joven emprendedora inicio a laborar en la venta de ropa usada. Los pedidos han aumentado por lo que tiene la necesidad de proporcionarle a sus clientes lo que ellos solicitan. Este es el segundo préstamo que solicita por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de salir adelante. Martha sueña con abrir un establecimiento al público en el mercado en donde asisten muchos clientes. Considera que no le teme a la competencia porque no es fácil ofrecer prendas de buena calidad a precios bajos como ella lo hace. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en: Martha Azucena is an enterprising young woman who began working selling used clothing.  Her orders have increased and as a result she needs to get her clients what they have requested.  This is the second loan that she has requested as she is always looking for a way to get ahead.  Martha dreams of opening her own establishment to sell to the public in the market where she has many customers.  She isn’t afraid of competition because she knows it isn’t easy to offer good quality clothing articles at low prices like she does.  The loan will be used to buy items to sell.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Primicia Group

texts.es:
El comité “Primicia” tiene  2 años de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya, la mayoría de sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas, pero incluyen entre sus integrantes  a  señoras que emprenderan actividades.  
Todas las señoras se encuentran muy entusiasmadas con los trabajos que vienen realizando cada una y también en grupo.
Este comité en particular es muy unido y una de las integrantes es la señora Zunilda quien se dedica actualmente  a la venta de ropas.
Ella trabaja mucho por su familia y de esa forma ayuda a su también a su marido en la manutención del hogar.
Se dedica a varias cosas a la vez, en ocasiones  prepara comestibles y vende lencerías por catálogos.
Pero actualmente está con el negocio de las ropas por la temporada que entra y solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercaderías para venta como remeras, vestidos, shorts, y otros.
texts.en:
The Primicia committee has been around for two years and works with Kiva Partner Fundación Paraguaya. The majority of its members already have businesses, but there are also members who are learning trades.

All the women are very enthusiastic about their work, each individually, and all of them as a whole.

This committee in particular is very united and one of the members is Zunilda, who is currently selling clothes.

She works a lot to benefit her family, and in this way she also helps her husband maintain the home.

She has several businesses at a time; on occasion she will prepare meals and sell lingerie out of a catalog.

But right now she is doing this clothing business for the season, and she is requesting this loan to purchase more merchandise to sell, such as t-shirts, dresses, shorts, etc.

loans.use: Purchase clothes such as t-shirts, shorts, dresses, and other merchandise

loans.name: Yukuyoo Group

texts.es:
El grupo D. crédito “Yukuyoo” se localiza en L. comunidad D. San L. Oaxaca a 40 minutos al norte D. Pinotepa nacional, el nombre del grupo se le da en L. lengua mixteca, que significa cerro D. bejucos (lianas), L. mayor parte D. L. población es D. raza indígena y se dedican al trabajo del campo, en el caso D. las mujeres al bordado y textiles artesanales, L. mujer que representa al grupo  se llama Flora M. C., pero no haremos mucha alusión acerca D. elL., ya que en esta narración hablaremos D. Herminia Nicolás M., es una mujer D. 35 años D. edad, casada con el señor Graciano D. 42 años, D. oficio campesino. Ellos tienen 4 hijos que son Guadalupe D. 18 años, Claudia D. 16, Álvaro D. 15 y Azucena D. 13 años D. edad, solo los últimos tres hermanos estudian, ya que L. mayor trabaja para ayudarles en los gastos escolares. Herminia se dedica a L. elaboración D. textiles en técnica artesanal, mismos que son muy laboriosos pero poco remunerados, elL. desD. temprana edad aprendió este oficio que es una D. las formas D. ayudar a mitigar parte D. las necesidades que tiene su familia, las artesanías que elL. elabora las hace desD. su casa como es D. costumbre y se utilizan materiales rústicos elaborados D. forma tradicional, es muy común encontrar a mujeres artesanas en esta zona ya que ellas aparte D. vender sus creaciones las utilizan para el uso personal D. vestimenta e indumentaria.
Herminia es miembro del grupo D. crédito organizado cerca D. su casa y elL. solicitó los recursos para L. compra D. materiales que utiliza en L. elaboración D. las artesanías con ese dinero elL. pudo comprar hilos D. algodón en color blanco, azul, verD., rojo , naranja , morado, así como madejas D. algodón que utilizan en L. elaboración D. textiles hilo torcido, estambre D. hilo tipo cristal y el tradicional hilo D. color café que es elaborado con algodón color café D. forma manual y artesanal en esta región, mandó a renovar algunas piezas D. su instrumento utilizada para el hilado D. textiles, mismo que utiliza para elaborar servilletas, manteles, huipiles, y telares para faldones. En esta temporada decembrina Herminia esta elaborando algunos pedidos que le encargaron con anticipación mismos que serán unos detalles para recuerdos D. bodas. 
Los grandes sueños que tiene Herminia es que sus hijos crezcan en un ambiente D. poca necesidad y lo único que piD. es tener buena salud para poder seguir adelante en L. lucha D. un mejor mañana, le gustaría tener una mejor vivienda con piso firme y un poco mas reforzada para aguantar los embates D. L. naturaleza en épocas D. lluvia.
Yukuyoo es un grupo D. mujeres trabajadoras, ellas se ayudan entre si y siempre hay en ellas L. confianza necesaria para que su grupo y sus integrantes sean puntuales en sus pagos.
Lo único que podemos agregar es un gesto D. agradecimiento por parte D. este grupo hacia los que representan esta industria D. sueños gracias a los que apoyan a kiva, a fundación realidad y L. gente que se entrega todos los días por hacer posible los proyectos D. muchos.
Las mujeres que integran el grupo “yukuyoo” se enlistan a continuación, así como las actividades que realizan.

Flora M. C.. – Cocina económica
Analidia Chávez D. L. C..- Bordado Artesanal
Gregoria Nicolás Baños.- Venta D. dulces
Andrea L. M..- Bordado Artesanal
Leticia M. Guzmán.- Venta D. pollos
Herminia Nicolás M..- Bordado Artesanal
Rosa P. Hernández.- Bordado Artesanal
Tomasa B. M..- Bordado Artesanal
Oliva Vásquez H..- Venta D. antojitos
Herlinda L. B..- Bordado Artesanal
texts.en:
The “Yukuyoo” loan group is located in the community of San L. Oaxaca, 40 minutes to the north of Pinotepa nacional. The name of the group is in the language of Mixteca and means ‘hill of lianas’ (a kind of vine). The majority of the population is indigenous and works in the fields and, in the case of the women, makes embroidery and artisanal textiles. The woman that represents the group is Flora M. C., but we will not talk about her much, since this story is focused on Herminia Nicolás M., a 35-year-old woman married to 42-year-old Gracian, an agricultural worker. They have four children: Guadalupe (18), Claudia (16), Álvaro (15) and Azucena (13). Only the last three study, since the eldest works to help them pay for school expenses.   Herminia works in the elaboration of textiles in the traditional style, which is very laborious, but poorly remunerated.  She learned this traD. from a very young age as one of the ways to help alleviate the needs of her family. She makes her craftwork in her home, as is the custom, and uses coarse materials maD. in the traditional way.  It is very common to find artisanal women in this zone since, apart from selling their creations, the women also wear them.

Herminia is a member of the loan group organized near her house, and she sought the resources to buy the materials that she will use to make her embroidery. With this money, she was able to buy cotton thread in the colors of white, blue, green, red, orange and purple as well as cotton skeins that they use to make textiles, crystal worsted yarn and the traditional brown thread that is maD. artisanally in this region by hand with brown colored cotton. She also sent to be renovated some of her instruments’ parts that she uses for the weaving of textiles and also to make napkins, tablecloths, huipiles (traditional embroidered dresses), and textiles for christening robes. In this December season, Herminia is filling some orders that were maD. ahead of time that will be for wedding souvenirs. 

The big dream that Herminia has is that her children grow up in an environment without a lot of need, and the only thing that she asks is to have good health in order to be able to continue ahead in the fight for a better tomorrow. She would like to have a better house that has a solid floor and is a little stronger so as to be able to withstand the ravages of nature in the periods of rain. 

Yukuyoo is a group of working women. They help one another and always have the necessary trust so that the group and its members are punctual with their payments. The only thing we can add is a gesture of thanks on behalf of this group to those that represent this industry of dreams. Thanks to those that support Kiva, to Fundación Realidad and to the people that dedicate themselves ever day to making possible the projects of many. The women that make up the “Yukuyoo” group are listed below, as well as the activities they carry out.  

Flora M. C.. – Inexpensive, home-cooking eatery
Analidia Chávez D. L. C..- Artisanal embroidery
Gregoria Nicolás Baños.- Sweets sales
Andrea L. M..- Artisanal embroidery
Leticia M. Guzmán.- Chicken sales
Herminia Nicolás M..- Artisanal embroidery
Rosa P. Hernández.- Artisanal embroidery
Tomasa B. M..- Artisanal embroidery
Oliva Vásquez H..- “Antojitos” (traditional Mexican food/snacks) sales
Herlinda L. B..- Artisanal embroidery

loans.use:
The loan will be used to buy cotton thread in the colors of red, blue, wine, green, yellow and purple, as well as to buy
cotton thread used to make artisenal textiles using tradtional waist looms, with which napkins and tablecloths are made.

loans.name: Raul Braulio

texts.es: El Sr. Raúl se encuentra en su segunda secuencia el tiene un hijo de 3 años, el vive en la casa de su mamá  que es la Sra. Benita que una cliente antigua de la institución  ya esta mas de 11 años trabajando con emprender, ellos viven en la zona de Chasquipampa, Raúl trabaja con la volqueta de su mamá  en la compra venta de arena fina, arena corriente y piedra en este momento requiere de incremento de capital, por lo que se solicita el financiamiento kiva por ser un buen cliente, es una persona trabajadora y responsable, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Raúl is in his second loan cycle.  He has a three year-old son and lives in his mom's house.  His mom, Benita, is a long-standing client of our institution.  She has been working with Emprender for more than 11 years.  They live in Chasquipampa district.

Raúl works with his mom's dump truck, buying and selling fine sand, medium-grade sand and stone.  Right now he needs an increase in his capital which is why he is requesting a Kiva loan.  He is a good client, hard working and responsible.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: To increase his capital (buying and selling sand and stone)

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: El señor Mauricio tiene 18 años de edad vive en la casa de su cuñado con su mama y hermana, viajo a Brasil cuando tenia 15 ahí trabajo como costurero y vio que se gana bien trabajo un año allá y retorno a Bolivia se compro dos maquinas de coser y empezó a confeccionar guantes de cuero que le entregan cortados el los arma y vende en Oruro y otros lugares  le va bien en el negocio, solicito el crédito para poder comprar una maquina de coser y guantes cortados de cuero para aumentar  su productividad y mejorar su estilo de vida, es un joven emprendedor con ganas de superación, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 18 years old and lives in his brother-in-law's house together with his mom and sister.

Mauricio traveled to Brazil when he was 15 years old and worked there as a garment worker.  He saw that the business pays well.  He worked in Brazil for one year and then returned to Bolivia where he bought two sewing machines and started making leather gloves.  He is delivered the pre-cut materials which he then stitches and sells in Oruro and other places.  His business is doing well and he is requesting this loan so that he can buy a sewing machine and pre-cut leather gloves so that he can increase his productivity and improve his lifestyle.

Mauricio is an enterprising young man who has a desire to improve himself.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and leather gloves

loans.name: Shirley Antuanet

texts.es:
Shirley tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres y hermanos en el caserío Las Monicas ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace dos años, ella  siembra limón en  terreno de cultivo que es herencia de sus padres, ella cosecha el limón semanalmente, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre es que ella ha ganado experiencia en este negocio.

Shirley desea adquirir fertilizantes y pesticidas para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de limón, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha y calidad en su fruto. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Shirley es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder crecer como empresaria y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Shirley is 19 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings in the rural Las Monicas settlement, located in the Tambogrande district.  This is an agricultural area that is located in the Piura province in the region of the same name, more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Shirley has been farming for 2 years.  She cultivates lemons on land that she inherited from her parents.  She harvests the lemons on a weekly basis.  Thanks to the teachings of her father, she has become experienced in this type of business.

Shirley wants to acquire fertilizers and pesticides to maintain her lemon crops.  In this way, she hopes to have a better harvest and better quality fruit.  To do this, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Shirley is a quite calm and responsible person.  Her main desire is to be able to grow as a businesswoman and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her crops

loans.name: 31 Thi Tran Van Ha-Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
"Xuyen N. T. (11) is a 41 year-old woman living in the town of T. Tran Van Ha Thieu Hoa, Thanh Hoa.  Xuyen is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 31 Van Ha Town Thieu Hoa (12.08.31).


Xuyen is married and has one school-aged child.  To making a living, Xuyen owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling school products, such pencils, pen & notebooks in the local community.  Xuyen has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,600,000 VND a monT. from these activities.


In 2011, Xuyen joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Xuyen is requesting a first loan of 5,787,900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  The loan will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Xuyen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. T. Nhung (5) is a 37 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


2.  L. T. Duyen (12) is a 30 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


3.  L. T. Quyen (8) is a 33 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


4.  D. T. Canh (10) is a 61 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Xuyen N. T. (11) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở T.ành phố T. tran van ha Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa.  Xuyen là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các T.ành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi T.ành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các T.ành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.  Tên chính T.ức của nhóm vay này là 31 T. Tran Van Ha Thieu Hoa (12.08.31).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương T.ức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các đồ dùng học tập như bút chì, bút viết & tập vở trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Xuyen T.ực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Xuyen kiếm được khoảng 2.600.000 VND.  Vào 2011, Xuyen đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có T.ể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Xuyen đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.787.900 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Nhung (5) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


2.  L. T. Duyen (12) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3.  L. T. Quyen (8) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


4.  D. T. Canh (10) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông T.ôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được T.ông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có T.ể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch T.ủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục T.ông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp T.ông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell
